Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Company

Payrails is an innovative technology company with a team that has many years of experience in the payment industry and a real-life understanding of the merchants‚Äô needs. We have seen the complexity firsthand and we have learned from all the challenges we've faced. Now we want to help leading technology companies around the world accept payments and build financial services with minimal upfront investments.

Our vision at Payrails is to reimagine payments. We do this by removing heavy reliance on Engineering efforts using composable building blocks that put the control firmly in the hands of our customers. We exist to help our customers become more productive and flexible, impacting directly on their ability to grow.

We are joined in our mission by top-tier investors Andreessen Horowitz, HV Capital, EQT and General Catalyst alongside a great cast of knowledgeable angel investors to enable us to solve the growing complexity of payments.

At Payrails, we are committed to building a team full of the most talented people. Excellence is part of our values and we understand that in order to achieve this, we need to build an environment where skilled people can work openly, collaboratively, and with the utmost trust in one another. We believe people thrive the most when they are fully aware of what the business is trying to achieve, why it is important to the market, and what challenges lie in the way to reaching our goals. In such an environment we believe people can truly excel, grow and enjoy working together. We try hard to be a company where everyone is inspired and feels a sense of responsibility to do the right thing to help us bring our vision to life. Succeeding with us is about finding solutions to the most pressing problems and executing them effectively.

Your Team

At Payrails, our Data team empowers all teams to uncover insights and transform them into actions that enhance the value and impact of our products and solutions. We champion data-enabled decision-making and recognize the importance of using the data as a tool to make optimal decisions.

What You Will Be Doing


You will develop and optimize reports, perform ad-hoc and deep-dive analyses to facilitate data-driven decision making.
You will improve and maintain our reporting data models, enabling self-service analytics across the company..
You will gain insights from the data and utilize them to enhance internal functions performance.
You will work in a highly effective team focusing on increasing the value and impact of our products.


You'll be great for this role if


You have more than 7 years of professional experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence or other related fields.
You have strong SQL skills, and have worked with GoodData, Tableau, Looker, or other Business Intelligence tools.
You have a solid knowledge of statistical techniques: distributions, statistical testing, regression, multivariate testing, etc.
You have experience in data analysis and can handle confidently large datasets
You have a good understanding of data modeling.
You are fluent in English and have excellent communication skills (both with technical and business teams).
Strong analytical and natural curiosity with a desire to explore new ideas, concepts, and ways to improve.
Proactive approach, taking initiative to anticipate needs and drive results independently.


Why You should join Payrails


You can truly create your own path by taking responsibility and implementing your own ideas
We offer visa and relocation support to you and your family where required
We offer a hybrid working environment
You have 27 annual vacation days + 1 day of paid birthday leave for you to have fun and party without any worries!
We get together regularly for team lunches and events
You help us shape the future of payments


At Payrails, we prioritize a culture of inclusivity and diversity, evaluating candidates solely based on their skills and potential, regardless of age, gender, identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and identities. In line with our commitment to fairness, we kindly request applicants to refrain from including personal details such as a picture, age, or marital status in their CVs.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - Sch√∂neberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years‚Äô experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You‚Äôll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe‚Äôs automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
This role can be based in either our Berlin DE, or Amsterdam NL office.

üë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª About the role

At Mondu we are moving fast in terms of building new products and processes. Also, we continually challenge our processes and improve them on an ongoing basis. For this, we are committed to a data-driven approach and rely on analytical insights. This role focuses on our core business processes in Operations. This includes reconciliation processes, customer support, and other Finance-related activities. Exemplary projects are setting up dashboards in the Customer Support area or the calculation of AP KPIs.

üöß What you'll do

Your role is about improving our Operations processes on an ongoing basis. For this purpose, you'll have to gain a good understanding of the business processes we run, define relevant KPIs that allow us to understand the efficiency of them and derive actionable conclusions. The job will require that you are able to connect different data sources, set up dashboards with relevant views, and analytically interpret the analyses.


Analyze current business processes and workflows using SQL / Python to identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance efficiency
Develop and implement process improvements applying methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, and Kaizen
Collaborate with various teams to understand their needs and challenges
Develop and present process improvement plans to senior management
Monitor the implementation of new processes and make or propose adjustments as needed
Train staff on new processes and ensure smooth transitions
Collect and analyze data to measure the effectiveness of process improvements
Prepare detailed reports and documentation on process changes
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in process improvement



Requirements

üèÖWhat you need to succeed

Please note: Do not be put off from applying because you believe you cannot tick every box. If you think you can help, and you really want to join our growing and exciting business please get in touch, we would love to hear from you.


At least Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related analytical field
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in continuous improvement or a related analytical role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven experience in using SQL or Python to analyze and/or automate processes
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Proven track record of successfully implementing process improvements
Proficiency in data analysis and process mapping tools
Strong project management skills



It would be a plus if you also have:


Previous experience working on an operational role.
Certification in process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Kaizen



Benefits

üéÅ What's in it for you?


‚Ç¨ 1000 per year for you to contribute to your learning & development to help you grow professionally and personally
‚Ç¨300 per year for you to endorse team build, including dinners, games, and events
28 vacation days per year (increasing 1 day every year up to 30)
We welcome you to our office in the center of Berlin or Amsterdam 3+ days a week
Take advantage of our Workation policy, allowing for up to 6 weeks every year of work outside of Germany (some restrictions apply)
Subsidised gym membership to boost your physical and mental well-being
‚Ç¨ 46 per month towards the DeutschlandTicket (for DE role) / public transport (for NL role)
Tax relief for payments into our Business Bike scheme
You can accelerate your career and take ownership of your work and development in a flat hierarchy where 360 feedback is encouraged.



ü¶∏ Are you a Monduneer in disguise?

Working in a truly diverse group makes us stronger and more resilient. Furthermore, it enables an unfair advantage - the opportunity to learn from each other, see different perspectives, and consider a broader range of variables in our decision-making. That is what being a Monduneer is all about.

Thus, regardless of your background, age, disability, gender, parental status, race, religion, sexual orientation, educational background, or any other aspect you feel is a statement of your diversity, we look forward to discussing your role in mind.

If you believe you are a Monduneer in disguise, and it's time for you to shine, submit your application, and we'll take it from there.

üíú Meet Mondu

At Mondu, we have the vision to disrupt and become the leader in B2B payments. We are building a Buy Now, Pay Later solution for B2B e-commerce businesses. Our business will address a new set of customer needs in a vast new market segment. To do so, we will need to re-invent core parts of the payment experience to serve the needs of business customers. Moreover, we will need to listen closely to local customer needs and tailor our approach to the requirements of local customers in Europe.

After hugely successful funding rounds, we are looking to move at a phenomenal pace and this will not be possible without the right people in the team.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there‚Äôs plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Marketing BI Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.




Your impact

Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.




Who you are

A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).




Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press ‚ÄúApply‚Äù anyway. We love your spirit!




What makes us special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‚Äòve created a range of perks for our employees:

A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.




Who we are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.




Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.

Title: Principal Data Analyst
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry, based in Berlin and Chicago. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing accurate sizing and fit recommendations, ultimately reducing returns and enhancing customer satisfaction.




As a trusted partner for e-commerce platforms and retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to revolutionizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.







Role Overview:




Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Principal Product Analyst from our Berlin office, where you'll play a critical leadership role in driving the success of our cutting-edge sizing and fit recommendation solutions.




As a seasoned professional, you will drive strategic decision-making and execution while providing mentorship and thought leadership across the organization. You will lead complex data-driven initiatives, optimize client implementation and performance, and spearhead the ideation and development of advanced insights tools.




Additionally, you will own the vision and delivery of our data science products ensuring alignment with broader business objectives. Your responsibilities will encompass everything from creating and executing A/B test programs to driving performance upgrade projects and driving reporting processes and automation, all while providing invaluable insights that contribute to improving and optimizing every stage of our product development and delivery process.







Key Responsibilities:




Showcase and exemplify to team members a high level of expertise in conducting investigative tasks, providing hands-on support to help clients understand performance and areas for improvement through effective data storytelling. Utilize analytical skills to delve deep into data, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client needs and challenges.




Proactively generate actionable insights aimed at improving our performance, processes and product features. Employ a data-driven mindset to identify opportunities for continuous optimization and innovation.




Lead the inception and implementation of A/B test programs, demonstrating a clear Return on Investment (ROI), and aligning initiatives with our overarching product vision in close collaboration with our data science and product teams.




Lead tooling and reporting automation initiatives to streamline and enhance accurate, data-centric decision-making in order to ensure a seamless alignment with business objectives.







Requirements and Qualifications:




7-12 years of experience in a product analytics or related role.




Expert proficient in SQL and python.




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to generate actionable business strategies.




Proven expertise in A/B testing, data analysis, and experimental design.




Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to convey complex analytical findings effectively to diverse stakeholders.




Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and a deep understanding of data science concepts.




Demonstrated ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement in product analytics processes.




Prior experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes is a strong plus.

Title: Product Analyst (All levels)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

Data is a critical part of our product development process and we are the chief advocates for its quality and usage. We are looking for a Principal Product Analyst (f/m/d) who can quickly jump in, understand, evaluate, recommend, and make an impact on the digital experiences on Zalando for customers.

You will be working in an exciting team focused on delivering a tailored discovery experience to our customers via great personalization, recommendation, browse and search experiences. Working closely with teams of Product Managers, Software Engineers, Applied Scientists, and Business Leaders, you will be leading data-explorations, A/B tests, hypothesis analysis, and other statistical approaches focused on understanding the products and the customers, as well as the continuous reporting and monitoring of critical business KPIs.

In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you‚Äôre great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups

WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Create a strategy, align with key partners, generate insights, deliver analysis, and deliver ongoing improvements independently for an ambiguous problem.
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding of what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved.
Be a data explorer, an educator, and a partner in decision making.
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Give (analytical) evidence supporting business decisions - investments, roll-out, and/or additional deep-dives.
Define the key performance metrics for the teams to judge and monitor product performance.
Advise in the set-up of A/B Tests or other quasi-experiments for new features and business opportunities, analysing, and deep-diving into the results to give recommendations.
Serve as an interface between data stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment, communication, and understanding of data products and analyses.



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 5+ years of relevant working experience in a data-intensive analytics role where you learned how to work with raw data, such as in Digital Analytics, Product Analytics, or Business Intelligence, preferably in e-commerce.
You have a strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined.
You have a strong knowledge of SQL, and you are comfortable working with nested/repeated data.
Strong knowledge of advanced analytics and statistical software languages (preferably Python), particularly regarding data clean up and manipulation. Familiarity with statistical models and prediction is a plus.
You have a strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and/or quasi-experimental analysis methodologies.
You are very comfortable working with onsite user behaviour data, from defining tracking specifications that capture relevant user actions to generating insights from the data (for example using Google Analytics or a similar service).
You have strong communication skills and the ability to explain processes, choices, and insights to stakeholders across all levels of seniority and technical background.



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counselling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!

HTML:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

Data is a critical part of our product development process and we are the chief advocates for its quality and usage. We are looking for a Principal Product Analyst (f/m/d) who can quickly jump in, understand, evaluate, recommend, and make an impact on the digital experiences on Zalando for customers.

You will be working in an exciting team focused on delivering a tailored discovery experience to our customers via great personalization, recommendation, browse and search experiences. Working closely with teams of Product Managers, Software Engineers, Applied Scientists, and Business Leaders, you will be leading data-explorations, A/B tests, hypothesis analysis, and other statistical approaches focused on understanding the products and the customers, as well as the continuous reporting and monitoring of critical business KPIs.

In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you‚Äôre great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups

WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


  • Create a strategy, align with key partners, generate insights, deliver analysis, and deliver ongoing improvements independently for an ambiguous problem.
  • Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding of what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved.
  • Be a data explorer, an educator, and a partner in decision making.
  • Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
  • Give (analytical) evidence supporting business decisions - investments, roll-out, and/or additional deep-dives.
  • Define the key performance metrics for the teams to judge and monitor product performance.
  • Advise in the set-up of A/B Tests or other quasi-experiments for new features and business opportunities, analysing, and deep-diving into the results to give recommendations.
  • Serve as an interface between data stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment, communication, and understanding of data products and analyses.


WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF


  • You have 5+ years of relevant working experience in a data-intensive analytics role where you learned how to work with raw data, such as in Digital Analytics, Product Analytics, or Business Intelligence, preferably in e-commerce.

  • You have a strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and/or quasi-experimental analysis methodologies.
  • You are very comfortable working with onsite user behaviour data, from defining tracking specifications that capture relevant user actions to generating insights from the data (for example using Google Analytics or a similar service).
  • You have strong communication skills and the ability to explain processes, choices, and insights to stakeholders across all levels of seniority and technical background.


OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


  • Employee shares program
  • 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
  • 2 paid volunteering days a year
  • Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
  • Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
  • 27 days of vacation a year to start
  • Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
  • Family services, including counselling and support
  • Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
  • Mental health support and coaching available

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie‚Äôs Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie‚Äôs portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our ‚ÄúCatch a Ride with Billie‚Äù program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als ‚ÄúData Analyst‚Äù (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und m√∂chtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein f√ºhrendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genie√üe die Flexibilit√§t, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen B√ºro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-L√∂sungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir f√∂rdern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsf√§higen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst gro√üe und komplexe Datens√§tze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verst√§ndnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Gesch√§ftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekr√§ftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern ‚Äì idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterst√ºtzt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Ma√ünahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualit√§t: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverl√§ssig erfasst werden. Daf√ºr unterst√ºtzt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst f√ºr eine effiziente Nutzung der verf√ºgbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgepr√§gtes Gesp√ºr f√ºr Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenh√§nge schnell und √ºbersetzt diese in pr√§zise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst gro√üe Datens√§tze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verst√§ndlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und wei√üt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsst√§rke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verst√§ndlich pr√§sentieren ‚Äì auch f√ºr Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalit√§t & Eigeninitiative: Du f√ºhlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, √ºbernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenst√§ndig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Flie√üende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind f√ºr diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen erm√∂glicht, die unsere Gesch√§ftsstrategie ma√ügeblich beeinflussen.

  • Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterst√ºtzt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
  • Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Ma√ünahmen zu steuern.
  • Tracking & Datenqualit√§t: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverl√§ssig erfasst werden. Daf√ºr unterst√ºtzt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
  • Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst f√ºr eine effiziente Nutzung der verf√ºgbaren Datenquellen.


Was wir suchen:

  • Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verst√§ndlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
  • Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und wei√üt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
  • Teamplayer & Kommunikationsst√§rke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verst√§ndlich pr√§sentieren ‚Äì auch f√ºr Nicht-Analysten.
  • Startup-Mentalit√§t & Eigeninitiative: Du f√ºhlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, √ºbernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenst√§ndig voran.
  • Sprachkenntnisse: Flie√üende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind f√ºr diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
  • Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
  • Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.


Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen erm√∂glicht, die unsere Gesch√§ftsstrategie ma√ügeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Mission

Wir suchen einen erfahrenen Senior Data Analyst, der komplexe Datens√§tze analysiert und aussagekr√§ftige Erkenntnisse liefert, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterst√ºtzen. Du arbeitest mit SQL, Python und Data-Visualization-Tools, um Datenprozesse zu optimieren und die Qualit√§t des Reportings zu verbessern. Fundierte Kenntnisse in Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS oder GCP sind essenziell, ebenso wie Erfahrung mit Data Warehouses wie Snowflake oder BigQuery. Dar√ºber hinaus arbeitest du eng mit cross-funktionalen Teams zusammen, unterst√ºtzt ETL-Workflows und nutzt dbt, um die Datenverarbeitung zu optimieren. Deine F√§higkeit, selbstst√§ndig zu arbeiten und dich in einem dynamischen Umfeld schnell anzupassen, ist entscheidend f√ºr den Erfolg in dieser Rolle.

Dein Profil


Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL, Python und Data-Visualization-Tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS und/oder GCP.
Expertise in Data Warehouses wie Snowflake oder BigQuery.
Kenntnisse in ETL-Workflows, Datenbankmanagementsystemen und dbt (Data Build Tool).
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich.
Erfahrung im Finanzsektor ist von Vorteil, aber nicht erforderlich.


√úber uns

Die Smartbroker-Gruppe betreibt unter anderem den Smartbroker+ ‚Äì einen mehrfach ausgezeichneten Online-Broker, der als einziger Anbieter in Deutschland das umfangreiche Produktspektrum der klassischen Broker mit den √§u√üerst g√ºnstigen Konditionen der Neobroker verbindet. Zum Portfolio geh√∂rt au√üerdem der digitale Fondsvermittler SMARTBROKER Finance (vormals: FondsDISCOUNT.de), gleichzeitig betreibt die Gruppe vier reichweitenstarke B√∂rsenportale (wallstreet-online.de, boersenNews.de, FinanzNachrichten.de und ARIVA.de). Mit mehreren Hundert Millionen monatlichen Seitenaufrufen ist die Gruppe der gr√∂√üte verlagsunabh√§ngige Finanzportalbetreiber im deutschsprachigen Raum und unterh√§lt au√üerdem die gr√∂√üte Finanz-Community.

Das Unternehmen geh√∂rt zu den Pionieren des digitalen Investments. Seit mehr als 25 Jahren setzen wir uns daf√ºr ein, die H√ºrden bei der Geldanlage abzubauen und eine nutzerfreundliche und preisg√ºnstige Abwicklung von Investments zu erm√∂glichen.

Der Schl√ºssel zu diesem Erfolg sind unsere Mitarbeiter:innen. Aufgrund der starken Wachstumsdynamik haben wir in den vergangenen Jahren zahlreiche attraktive Arbeitspl√§tze geschaffen. Jeden Tag streben wir danach, das beste Team aufzubauen und unseren Mitarbeiter:innen den Raum zu geben, sich selbst bestm√∂glich zu entwickeln. Ein vielf√§ltiges Team aus Leistungstr√§gern sorgt daf√ºr, dass wir alle jeden Tag dazulernen. Aus einem kleinen Team mit ca. 20 Personen sind wir inzwischen ein Unternehmen mit rund 260 Mitarbeiter:innen (Stand 31.12.2023) geworden, das in einem modernen B√ºro in Berlin-Kreuzberg sitzt.

Wir verstehen uns als innovatives Fintech, das in eine erfolgreiche Unternehmensgruppe eingebettet ist und damit pers√∂nliche Arbeitsatmosph√§re mit den Vorteilen einer finanzstarken Aktiengesellschaft verbindet. In allen Unternehmensteilen setzen wir auf flache Hierarchien, individuelle Entwicklung und agile Prozesse. Wir sind stolz auf den pers√∂nlichen Zusammenhalt im Team und die √ºberdurchschnittlich lange Betriebszugeh√∂rigkeit vieler Angestellter. Wir setzen uns f√ºr Vielfalt und Chancengleichheit ein. Wir streben danach, ein Team aufzubauen, das eine Vielzahl von Hintergr√ºnden, Perspektiven und F√§higkeiten repr√§sentiert. Je integrativer wir sind, desto besser wird unsere Arbeit und unser Team sein.

Wenn auch du Teil dieses schnell wachsenden Unternehmens werden m√∂chtest, dann bewirb dich jetzt bei der Smartbroker Gruppe.

Wir ermutigen Frauen, nicht-bin√§re und Transgender-Personen sowie alle Mitglieder der LGBTQI+-Community, Menschen mit marginalisiertem ethnischen Hintergrund und Menschen mit sichtbaren oder nicht sichtbaren Behinderungen, sich zu bewerben, wenn sie ein integratives, vielf√§ltiges und sicheres Arbeitsumfeld suchen.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you‚Äôre stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can‚Äôt wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.

Aufgaben

Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.

Ein kommerzielles Verst√§ndnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.

Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit g√§ngigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.


Du hast ausgepr√§gte analytische und konzeptionelle F√§higkeiten.


Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.

Attraktive Verg√ºnstigungen in diversen Shops √ºber Corporate Benefits

30 Urlaubstage


M√∂glichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)

Wohlf√ºhl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen B√ºros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitspl√§tze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Product Analytics (m/w/d)
Description:
FIXING THE PLANET BY MAKING HOMES CARBON-FREE!


With ‚Ç¨35 million in funding from top-tier investors such as COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global, we are working towards a future where climate-neutral buildings - simply & rapidly - become a reality. At Enter, we aggregate and analyze relevant building data so that homeowners can sustainably reduce their energy costs and increase the value of their property.




We believe in:





Common code access


No gatekeepers


Simplicity over industry standards


Embracing the small change


Each API is a product


Baked in quality





We‚Äôre looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.


Deine Aufgaben



Create and maintain the product analytics dashboards and related KPIs, ensuring alignment with contract compliance and minimizing incidents.


Manage the lifecycle of all data products in our visualization tool Metabase, including decommissioning unused dashboards, aiming for less than 5% unused dashboards weekly.


Increase the weekly usage of Metabase to 80% within your crew.


Ensure the Metabase structure is organized and easy to navigate.


Take responsibility for the correctness of data, regardless of the origin of any issues.


Be a key resource for team members to improve their ability to read and interpret data effectively.



Dein Profil



You have extensive experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, maintaining dashboards and KPIs (5+ years of experience)


You have advanced proficiency in managing data products in Metabase or similar platforms.


Experience with Product Analytic tools like Amplitude and Event based reportings is a plus.


You have a strong understanding of data lifecycle management, including cleaning up and decommissioning unused assets.


You have analytical skills and pay attention to detail, with a focus on data accuracy and quality.


You have excellent communication and collaboration skills to support crew leads and team members in understanding and using data.


You have the ability to combine technical data expertise with domain-specific knowledge.


You are fluent in English (German is a plus, but not required).



Benefits



Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.


Attractive & competitive compensation.


Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.


Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.


Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.


Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.

HTML:
FIXING THE PLANET BY MAKING HOMES CARBON-FREE!

With ‚Ç¨35 million in funding from top-tier investors such as COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global, we are working towards a future where climate-neutral buildings - simply & rapidly - become a reality. At Enter, we aggregate and analyze relevant building data so that homeowners can sustainably reduce their energy costs and increase the value of their property.


We believe in:



  • Common code access

  • No gatekeepers

  • Simplicity over industry standards

  • Embracing the small change

  • Each API is a product

  • Baked in quality


We‚Äôre looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.


Deine Aufgaben

  • Create and maintain the product analytics dashboards and related KPIs, ensuring alignment with contract compliance and minimizing incidents.

  • Manage the lifecycle of all data products in our visualization tool Metabase, including decommissioning unused dashboards, aiming for less than 5% unused dashboards weekly.

  • Increase the weekly usage of Metabase to 80% within your crew.

  • Ensure the Metabase structure is organized and easy to navigate.

  • Take responsibility for the correctness of data, regardless of the origin of any issues.

  • Be a key resource for team members to improve their ability to read and interpret data effectively.


Dein Profil

  • You have extensive experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, maintaining dashboards and KPIs (5+ years of experience)

  • You have advanced proficiency in managing data products in Metabase or similar platforms.

  • Experience with Product Analytic tools like Amplitude and Event based reportings is a plus.

  • You have a strong understanding of data lifecycle management, including cleaning up and decommissioning unused assets.

  • You have analytical skills and pay attention to detail, with a focus on data accuracy and quality.

  • You have excellent communication and collaboration skills to support crew leads and team members in understanding and using data.

  • You have the ability to combine technical data expertise with domain-specific knowledge.

  • You are fluent in English (German is a plus, but not required).


Benefits

  • Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.

  • Attractive & competitive compensation.

  • Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.

  • Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.

  • Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.

  • Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.

Title: Market Intelligence Analyst for Poland (w/m/d)
Description:
Our Renewables Team in Berlin and/or Stettin is looking for you!

Deine Aufgaben


Vertiefung des Verst√§ndnisses des Teams f√ºr aktuelle und erwartete Marktentwicklungen, regulatorische Rahmenbedingungen, einschlie√ülich Beschreibungen der wichtigsten Auktionsmechanismen, Entwicklung von Auktionsprognosen und Herausforderungen (z. B. K√ºrzung)
F√∂rderung der Marktexpertise mit dem Ziel, alle erforderlichen Beitr√§ge f√ºr den Strategie√ºberpr√ºfungsprozess des Unternehmens sowie f√ºr seine Arbeit an LCOEs bereitzustellen
√úberwachung und Analyse der Aktivit√§ten der Wettbewerber und der Marktbedingungen, die f√ºr die Branche der erneuerbaren Energien spezifisch sind, um die strategische Planung zu informieren, neue M√∂glichkeiten zu identifizieren und Positionierungsstrategien nach Bedarf anzupassen
√úberpr√ºfung interner und externer Preisprognosen und Kennzeichnung potenzieller Risiken
Entwicklung einer Meinung zu PPAs zusammen mit dem Input des Trading-Teams von Uniper
M√∂glichkeit, Verst√§ndnis f√ºr andere M√§rkte f√ºr erneuerbare Energien zu entwickeln und bei der Identifizierung von Markteintrittsoptionen zu helfen
Arbeite mit funktions√ºbergreifenden Teams zusammen, einschlie√ülich, aber nicht beschr√§nkt auf Projektentwicklung, EPCO, kommerzielle Analyse, Marktanalyse, um die Position des Unternehmens im Land zu verbessern


Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsrecht oder vergleichbares Studium
2 - 5 Jahre einschl√§gige Berufserfahrung
Expertise in den M√§rkten f√ºr Strom und erneuerbare Energien, Preisgestaltungssysteme sowie regulatorische Verg√ºtungssysteme und das Bestreben, den √úbergang zu erneuerbaren Energien zu unterst√ºtzen
Ausgepr√§gtes analytisches, strategisches, unternehmerisches Denken, kombiniert mit einem wissbegierigen Geist
Leichtigkeit und Interesse, F√§higkeiten im Projektmanagement zu entwickeln, Stakeholder kollaborativ einzubinden und neue Herausforderungen anzunehmen
Kreativer und aufgeschlossener Mensch mit einem guten Sinn f√ºr Humor
Verhandlungssichere Kenntnisse in Polnisch und Englisch (weitere Sprachen willkommen)

Title: Market Intelligence Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
Requisition Number: 64998

Corning is vital to progress ‚Äì in the industries we help shape and in the world we share.

We invent life-changing technologies using materials science. Our scientific and manufacturing expertise, boundless curiosity, and commitment to purposeful invention place us at the center of the way the world interacts, works, learns, and lives.

Our sustained investment in research, development, and invention means we‚Äôre always ready to solve the toughest challenges alongside our customers.

Our Optical Communications segment has recently evolved from being a manufacturer of optical fiber and cable, hardware and equipment to being a comprehensive provider of industry-leading optical solutions across the broader communications industry.This segment is classified into two main product groupings ‚Äì carrier network and enterprise network. The carrier network product group consists primarily of products and solutions for optical-based communications infrastructure for services such as video, data and voice communications. The enterprise network product group consists primarily of optical-based communication networks sold to businesses, governments and individuals for their own use.

For our Berlin Headquarter (or Strykow, Poland) we are currently looking for a

Market Intelligence Specialist (m/f/d)

Responsibilities


Analyze news quickly to uncover and disseminate meaningful insights on market landscape.
Analyze the impact of new market and competitive developments affecting Corning.
Support the EMEA MI OCS Lead in ad-hoc MI projects.
Support maintenance of MI knowledge sharing platform and mobile app. Structure, organize and maintain MI content architecture to maximize customer experience and utility. Scope covers training, marketing campaigns, leveraging usage analytics, troubleshooting, driving collaborative platform to build and exchange rich MI insights.
Strengthen linkages between the MI Team and COC‚Äôs Commercial and Business Intelligence Teams to enhance MI collaboration.
Maintain and disseminate competitor one-pagers. Collaborate with COC and MI team to chronicle key events and articulate business implications.
Monitor intelligence sources (e.g. competitors‚Äô web sites) and assist OCS Strategy Team in compiling daily and weekly English-language market intelligence communications.
Measure usage of these market intelligence communications with quantitative statistics; use to drive continuous improvement.
Conduct secondary market research to gather relevant information from a variety of sources and integrate into competitive and market intelligence projects.
Support administrative tasks related to MI newsletters platform (create new MI newsletters, maintain search taxonomy, resolve technical issues); collaborate with external MI software provider; maintain MI Share Point and Box sites/content; maintain MI Team‚Äôs e-mail box, distribution lists, etc.
Conduct comparative analysis for competitors vs. Corning EMEA (e.g. manufacturing costs, product costs, financial analysis).


Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Finance or relevant field required. Master‚Äôs degree in Business Intelligence or Business Administration preferred.
Previous relevant job experience in Market Research, Competitive + Market Intelligence and/or Data Analytics.
Minimum 2-3 years of work experience, preferably in the telecom industry.
Strong knowledge of Market Intelligence related processes.
Good understanding of Corning Optical Communications product portfolio, target markets as well as our competitors and customers' landscape.
Fluent in English, written and spoken. Polish language skills are a benefit.
Structured and analytical thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Sound understanding of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
Quick learner; persistent, takes initiative, determined, resilient.
Experience with Power BI and AI desired.


Workplaces


Berlin, Germany or Strykow, Poland. Hybrid working conditions (2 days per week at home and 3 days in the office).


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. To request an accommodation, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com .

Title: B2B Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About

Was wir suchen ...

Zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir einen B2B Data Analyst (all genders), der nicht nur Zahlen analysiert, sondern auch die richtigen Schl√ºsse zieht, Trends erkennt und neue M√∂glichkeiten aufzeigt. Wenn du Lust hast, mit deinem Daten-Know-how Prozesse zu optimieren, smarte Prognosen zu erstellen und unser B2B-Business aufs n√§chste Level zu bringen, dann freuen wir uns, von dir zu h√∂ren.

Wichtig: F√ºr diese Position sind Deutschkenntnisse mindestens auf B2-Niveau ein Muss.

Deine Aufgaben

Du analysierst interne und externe Datenquellen und findest die relevanten Insights.

Du erstellst Forecasts, Demand Plannings und Co., damit alle wissen, wo die Reise hingeht.

Du beantwortest Fragen des B2B-Teams, testest Hypothesen und ziehst proaktiv Schl√ºsse aus den Daten ‚Äì immer mit Blick auf konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen.

Du nutzt vorhandene Daten, um Vorhersagen zu m√∂glichen Kampagnen-Ergebnissen zu treffen.

Du baust eine neue Datenstruktur auf, die alle notwendigen Standard-Reportings enth√§lt ‚Äì gemeinsam mit dem Team legst du fest, wie maximale Transparenz und Sichtbarkeit erreicht werden k√∂nnen.

Du identifizierst Gesch√§ftsm√∂glichkeiten: Sei es durch das Erkennen von Marketing- und Kampagnentrends, die Verbesserung interner Prozesse oder durch den Einsatz datengetriebener Plattformen, die Vertriebsaktivit√§ten transparenter machen

Dein Profil

fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse und Business Intelligence (BI)

umfangreiche Kenntnisse in mathematischen und statistischen Analysen sowie den entsprechenden Tools

schnelle Auffassungsgabe zur √úbersetzung komplexer Anforderungen in konkrete Aufgaben

service- und l√∂sungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit einer Balance aus Perfektionismus und Pragmatismus

vision√§re Denkweise, um Innovationen voranzutreiben und das B2B-Gesch√§ft weiterzuentwickeln

Sicherstellung von Datenintegrit√§t und -genauigkeit sowie Optimierung von Datenprozessen

Erfahrung mit Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI und Programmierung in Python oder R

F√§higkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen in umsetzbare Erkenntnisse f√ºr Entscheidungstr√§ger zu √ºbersetzen

akademischer Abschluss in einem betriebswirtschaftlichen Fachbereich oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrungen

Warum wir?

Wir sind ein motiviertes Team mit echtem Zusammenhalt ‚Äì wir unterst√ºtzen einander.

Du wirst schnell ein fester Teil unseres Teams und kannst deine Ideen jederzeit einbringen.

F√ºr alles, was deinen Job einfacher oder flexibler macht, bekommst du ein Budget.

Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office? Machen wir m√∂glich ‚Äì ganz unkompliziert in Absprache.

28 Urlaubstage warten auf dich ‚Äì und jedes Jahr bei uns gibt‚Äôs einen extra Tag obendrauf (bis max. 30).

Stell dir jeden Monat Gutscheine im Wert von 50 Euro zusammen ‚Äì bei vielen spannenden Partner*innen.

Dein Deutschland-Ticket? Das √ºbernehmen wir f√ºr dich!

Nutze unseren Zugang zu OpenUp f√ºr anonyme, professionelle Unterst√ºtzung - f√ºr deine mentale Gesundheit.

Regelm√§√üige Team-Aktivit√§ten, ob im Office oder drau√üen, geh√∂ren bei uns dazu.

Teste Produktneuheiten und Trends, bevor sie auf den Markt kommen.

Sichere dir exklusive Rabatte auf unser Sortiment und viele weitere Vorteile mit Corporate Benefits.

Modernes Arbeiten mit Apple-Produkten und einem funktionalen Arbeitsplatz ist bei uns Standard.

Du willst dich bewerben? Dann los!

Schicke uns deinen Lebenslauf sowie ein kurzes Anschreiben unter der Angabe deiner Gr√ºnde, warum DU unser Perfect Match bist.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

√úber uns

Als Beauty-Onlineshop bringen wir deine liebsten Produkte kuratierter Marken aus den USA, UK & Co. nach Deutschland und sehen uns dabei auch als Sprungbrett f√ºr kleine, noch wachsende Beauty-Brands.

Denn neben unserer Pr√§senz als Beauty-Onlineshop arbeiten wir hinter den Kulissen auch als Distributor f√ºr innovative Marken aus dem Ausland. Dazu geh√∂ren Geek & Gorgeous, RevitaLash und The Fox Tan, denen wir neue Zug√§nge zu bekannten Retailern in Europa er√∂ffnen.

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag f√ºr Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH f√∂rdert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertsch√§tzung von Vielfalt. Daher begr√º√üen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalit√§ten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identit√§ten sowie aller Altersgruppen und m√∂glichen Einschr√§nkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!
