Title: Senior Data Analyst - Size & Fit (all genders)
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst for Size & Fit , you will play a key role in addressing the challenge of finding the right fit in online shopping.

Size and Fit works towards solving the customer problem of not being able to find the right fit in online shopping. Our mission involves gaining a deep understanding of customers‚Äô preferences related to size and fit, as well as a comprehensive knowledge of the assortment attributes and measurements from our brands. The real magic happens when we successfully match both.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Size and Fit team, which includes members from Product Management, Analytics, Applied Science, and Engineering. You will act as a bridge to the commercial team. You will measure and analyze how the solutions we provide to our customers are impacting our business and your insights will enable strategic commercial decisions at Zalando.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Bring the business data-driven analytical approach to the Size & Fit Team; you generate hypotheses and try to test them by performing descriptive, exploratory and quantitative analyses. You can translate data into actionable insights for the business. You know when a hypothesis can only be tested by an experiment, and you can help create and drive them.
You are the connector between the Product and the Business. You can translate the Size and Fit benefits to answer complex business questions and identify and measure commercial opportunities.
Be a reliable partner for the Size & Fit Team when related to commercial reporting and analytics, and support the Team with more complex analysis.
Avoid working in silos by collaborating with cross-functional leaders from Applied Science, Product, Content and Customer Analytics to drive innovation. You incorporate data from different sources within and outside of Zalando to drive projects.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




Proven track record of 5+ experience in analytics A university degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Quantitative social science, or a comparable subject.
Strong technical background with advanced SQL skills and programming background (e.g. Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks). Excellent knowledge in coding for data retrieval, exploration and analysis. Advanced statistical skills such as A/B testing and causal inference. Constant drive and tenacity to learn new techniques and tools are a must.
Understanding of the economics of online platforms and/or online fashion retailers, as well as the commercial KPIs governing their success.
Effective communication to convince any audience with the insights you generate and compelling storytelling in any form that enables decision-making.
Enjoy working cross-functionally; you have great stakeholder management skills to work with different levels of management to support, challenge and bring solutions.
Hands-on mentality, a person who always finds solutions to challenges. You are proactive, can adapt quickly to changes and always remain focused on our quality objectives.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits; here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counselling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching are available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Idealerweise erste praktische Erfahrungen im Kontext von Dokumentenmanagement und KI

Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum √ñPNV
Durch das offene high-end B√ºrokonzept leben wir t√§glich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenh√∂he

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Consumer & Market Insights (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


The Consumer & Market Insights team plays a crucial role in shaping customer-centric strategies at Zalando. By focusing on in-depth analytics and research, the team uncovers valuable insights that inform decision-making and enhance our competitive edge. The understanding of consumer needs and behaviours enables more effective sales, marketing, product development, and overall business strategies.

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Brand & Satisfaction tracking sub-team, your goal is to shed light on what drives customer perception and behaviour, leveraging the wide variety of data sources at your disposal. You will act as the voice of our customers internally and support data-driven decisions to improve their experience.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Connecting transactional data, onsite behavioural data and perception insights (derived from customer and panel surveys) to build a holistic understanding of our customers‚Äô experience
Successfully leading and owning analytical projects by conducting descriptive, diagnostic and predictive analytics using state-of-the-art modelling techniques and deriving recommendations for our stakeholders.
Support more junior analysts with guidance and sparring, leveraging your knowledge and experience to raise the bar for analytics within the team




WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




University degree in economics, computer science, mathematics, statistics, or in a similar quantitative field
Proven track record of a minimum of 5 years in a highly analytical role, ideally in an e-commerce environment
Strong analytical skills and solid understanding of statistical methods, with the ability to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets
Solid programming skills in SQL and in Python, as well as experience with Google Analytics (BigQuery)
Previous experience with data visualisation tools (e. g. Microstrategy, Tableau, PowerBI) is a plus
Knowledge of time series forecasting and causality (causal inference and A/B testing) is considered a plus
Ability to concisely communicate the essence, conveying meaningful and relevant insights to analytical and non-analytical stakeholders alike
Excellent verbal and written English skills




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us


Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

  • Ability to concisely communicate the essence, conveying meaningful and relevant insights to analytical and non-analytical stakeholders alike
  • Excellent verbal and written English skills



OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


  • Employee shares program
  • 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
  • 2 paid volunteering days a year
  • Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
  • Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
  • 27 days of vacation a year to start
  • Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
  • Family services, including counseling and support
  • Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
  • Mental health support and coaching available
  • Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review


Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us


Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Title: Senior Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As a Decision Scientist in our Help Experience domain, you‚Äôll play a key role in enhancing the support experience for our Vinted members. This role will be embedded in a new cross-functional product team within the domain, where you will take the lead in driving experimentation. You will collaborate closely with your team to deliver impactful, data-informed decisions that improve quality, scalability, and efficiency in support operations through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we‚Äôre building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation ‚Äì translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of Data Science & Analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The base salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨69,700 - ‚Ç¨94,300 gross per year.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value‚Ä¶)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Specialist (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there‚Äôs plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Marketing BI Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.




Your impact

Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.




Who you are

A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).




Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press ‚ÄúApply‚Äù anyway. We love your spirit!




What makes us special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‚Äòve created a range of perks for our employees:

A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.




Who we are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.




Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.

Show more
HTML:
As a Marketing BI Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.


Your impact

  • Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
  • Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
  • Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
  • Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
  • Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
  • Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
  • Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.


Who you are

  • A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
  • Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
  • Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
  • Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
  • Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
  • Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
  • Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
  • Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).


Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press ‚ÄúApply‚Äù anyway. We love your spirit!

Title: Product Analyst (All levels)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

Data is a critical part of our product development process and we are the chief advocates for its quality and usage. We are looking for a Principal Product Analyst (f/m/d) who can quickly jump in, understand, evaluate, recommend, and make an impact on the digital experiences on Zalando for customers.

You will be working in an exciting team focused on delivering a tailored discovery experience to our customers via great personalization, recommendation, browse and search experiences. Working closely with teams of Product Managers, Software Engineers, Applied Scientists, and Business Leaders, you will be leading data-explorations, A/B tests, hypothesis analysis, and other statistical approaches focused on understanding the products and the customers, as well as the continuous reporting and monitoring of critical business KPIs.

In addition, you will benefit from a network of Product Analysts, who share similar challenges across the company, to learn and develop your skills.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you‚Äôre great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups

WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Create a strategy, align with key partners, generate insights, deliver analysis, and deliver ongoing improvements independently for an ambiguous problem.
Develop in-depth analytical (user) understanding of what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved.
Be a data explorer, an educator, and a partner in decision making.
Challenge and contribute to product decisions based on your insights
Give (analytical) evidence supporting business decisions - investments, roll-out, and/or additional deep-dives.
Define the key performance metrics for the teams to judge and monitor product performance.
Advise in the set-up of A/B Tests or other quasi-experiments for new features and business opportunities, analysing, and deep-diving into the results to give recommendations.
Serve as an interface between data stakeholders across the organization to ensure alignment, communication, and understanding of data products and analyses.



WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 5+ years of relevant working experience in a data-intensive analytics role where you learned how to work with raw data, such as in Digital Analytics, Product Analytics, or Business Intelligence, preferably in e-commerce.
You have a strong knowledge of e-commerce KPIs and how they can be defined.
You have a strong knowledge of SQL, and you are comfortable working with nested/repeated data.
Strong knowledge of advanced analytics and statistical software languages (preferably Python), particularly regarding data clean up and manipulation. Familiarity with statistical models and prediction is a plus.
You have a strong knowledge of A/B testing best practices and/or quasi-experimental analysis methodologies.
You are very comfortable working with onsite user behaviour data, from defining tracking specifications that capture relevant user actions to generating insights from the data (for example using Google Analytics or a similar service).
You have strong communication skills and the ability to explain processes, choices, and insights to stakeholders across all levels of seniority and technical background.



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counselling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!



If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!

Title: Staff Data Analyst, DATA (m/f/d)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You‚Äôll Do


Accountable for your teams‚Äô data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the ‚Äúso-whats‚Äù of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


#Data

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here

JR102528

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie‚Äôs Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie‚Äôs portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives

You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

HTML:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie‚Äôs Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities

  • Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
  • Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
  • Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
  • Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
  • Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
  • Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie‚Äôs portfolio
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
  • Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
  • Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners

Who We Are Looking For

  • You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
  • Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
  • Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
  • Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
  • Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
  • You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
  • You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

What We Offer

  • Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
  • Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
  • Our ‚ÄúCatch a Ride with Billie‚Äù program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. Title: Principal Data Analyst
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry, based in Berlin and Chicago. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing accurate sizing and fit recommendations, ultimately reducing returns and enhancing customer satisfaction.




As a trusted partner for e-commerce platforms and retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to revolutionizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.







Role Overview:




Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Principal Product Analyst from our Berlin office, where you'll play a critical leadership role in driving the success of our cutting-edge sizing and fit recommendation solutions.




As a seasoned professional, you will drive strategic decision-making and execution while providing mentorship and thought leadership across the organization. You will lead complex data-driven initiatives, optimize client implementation and performance, and spearhead the ideation and development of advanced insights tools.




Additionally, you will own the vision and delivery of our data science products ensuring alignment with broader business objectives. Your responsibilities will encompass everything from creating and executing A/B test programs to driving performance upgrade projects and driving reporting processes and automation, all while providing invaluable insights that contribute to improving and optimizing every stage of our product development and delivery process.







Key Responsibilities:




Showcase and exemplify to team members a high level of expertise in conducting investigative tasks, providing hands-on support to help clients understand performance and areas for improvement through effective data storytelling. Utilize analytical skills to delve deep into data, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client needs and challenges.




Proactively generate actionable insights aimed at improving our performance, processes and product features. Employ a data-driven mindset to identify opportunities for continuous optimization and innovation.




Lead the inception and implementation of A/B test programs, demonstrating a clear Return on Investment (ROI), and aligning initiatives with our overarching product vision in close collaboration with our data science and product teams.




Lead tooling and reporting automation initiatives to streamline and enhance accurate, data-centric decision-making in order to ensure a seamless alignment with business objectives.







Requirements and Qualifications:




7-12 years of experience in a product analytics or related role.




Expert proficient in SQL and python.




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to generate actionable business strategies.




Proven expertise in A/B testing, data analysis, and experimental design.




Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to convey complex analytical findings effectively to diverse stakeholders.




Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and a deep understanding of data science concepts.




Demonstrated ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement in product analytics processes.




Prior experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes is a strong plus.

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
This role can be based in either our Berlin DE, or Amsterdam NL office.

üë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª About the role

At Mondu we are moving fast in terms of building new products and processes. Also, we continually challenge our processes and improve them on an ongoing basis. For this, we are committed to a data-driven approach and rely on analytical insights. This role focuses on our core business processes in Operations. This includes reconciliation processes, customer support, and other Finance-related activities. Exemplary projects are setting up dashboards in the Customer Support area or the calculation of AP KPIs.

üöß What you'll do

Your role is about improving our Operations processes on an ongoing basis. For this purpose, you'll have to gain a good understanding of the business processes we run, define relevant KPIs that allow us to understand the efficiency of them and derive actionable conclusions. The job will require that you are able to connect different data sources, set up dashboards with relevant views, and analytically interpret the analyses.


Analyze current business processes and workflows using SQL / Python to identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance efficiency
Develop and implement process improvements applying methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, and Kaizen
Collaborate with various teams to understand their needs and challenges
Develop and present process improvement plans to senior management
Monitor the implementation of new processes and make or propose adjustments as needed
Train staff on new processes and ensure smooth transitions
Collect and analyze data to measure the effectiveness of process improvements
Prepare detailed reports and documentation on process changes
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in process improvement



Requirements

üèÖWhat you need to succeed

Please note: Do not be put off from applying because you believe you cannot tick every box. If you think you can help, and you really want to join our growing and exciting business please get in touch, we would love to hear from you.


At least Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related analytical field
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in continuous improvement or a related analytical role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven experience in using SQL or Python to analyze and/or automate processes
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Proven track record of successfully implementing process improvements
Proficiency in data analysis and process mapping tools
Strong project management skills



It would be a plus if you also have:


Previous experience working on an operational role.
Certification in process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Kaizen



Benefits

üéÅ What's in it for you?


‚Ç¨ 1000 per year for you to contribute to your learning & development to help you grow professionally and personally
‚Ç¨300 per year for you to endorse team build, including dinners, games, and events
28 vacation days per year (increasing 1 day every year up to 30)
We welcome you to our office in the center of Berlin or Amsterdam 3+ days a week
Take advantage of our Workation policy, allowing for up to 6 weeks every year of work outside of Germany (some restrictions apply)
Subsidised gym membership to boost your physical and mental well-being
‚Ç¨ 46 per month towards the DeutschlandTicket (for DE role) / public transport (for NL role)
Tax relief for payments into our Business Bike scheme
You can accelerate your career and take ownership of your work and development in a flat hierarchy where 360 feedback is encouraged.



ü¶∏ Are you a Monduneer in disguise?

Working in a truly diverse group makes us stronger and more resilient. Furthermore, it enables an unfair advantage - the opportunity to learn from each other, see different perspectives, and consider a broader range of variables in our decision-making. That is what being a Monduneer is all about.

Thus, regardless of your background, age, disability, gender, parental status, race, religion, sexual orientation, educational background, or any other aspect you feel is a statement of your diversity, we look forward to discussing your role in mind.

If you believe you are a Monduneer in disguise, and it's time for you to shine, submit your application, and we'll take it from there.

üíú Meet Mondu

At Mondu, we have the vision to disrupt and become the leader in B2B payments. We are building a Buy Now, Pay Later solution for B2B e-commerce businesses. Our business will address a new set of customer needs in a vast new market segment. To do so, we will need to re-invent core parts of the payment experience to serve the needs of business customers. Moreover, we will need to listen closely to local customer needs and tailor our approach to the requirements of local customers in Europe.

After hugely successful funding rounds, we are looking to move at a phenomenal pace and this will not be possible without the right people in the team.
Show more
HTML:
This role can be based in either our Berlin DE, or Amsterdam NL office.

üë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª About the role

At Mondu we are moving fast in terms of building new products and processes. Also, we continually challenge our processes and improve them on an ongoing basis. For this, we are committed to a data-driven approach and rely on analytical insights. This role focuses on our core business processes in Operations. This includes reconciliation processes, customer support, and other Finance-related activities. Exemplary projects are setting up dashboards in the Customer Support area or the calculation of AP KPIs.

üöß What you'll do

Your role is about improving our Operations processes on an ongoing basis. For this purpose, you'll have to gain a good understanding of the business processes we run, define relevant KPIs that allow us to understand the efficiency of them and derive actionable conclusions. The job will require that you are able to connect different data sources, set up dashboards with relevant views, and analytically interpret the analyses.

  • Analyze current business processes and workflows using SQL / Python to identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance efficiency
  • Develop and implement process improvements applying methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, and Kaizen
  • Collaborate with various teams to understand their needs and challenges
  • Develop and present process improvement plans to senior management
  • Monitor the implementation of new processes and make or propose adjustments as needed
  • Train staff on new processes and ensure smooth transitions
  • Collect and analyze data to measure the effectiveness of process improvements
  • Prepare detailed reports and documentation on process changes
  • Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in process improvement


Requirements

üèÖWhat you need to succeed

Please note: Do not be put off from applying because you believe you cannot tick every box. If you think you can help, and you really want to join our growing and exciting business please get in touch, we would love to hear from you.

  • At least Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related analytical field
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in continuous improvement or a related analytical role
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven experience in using SQL or Python to analyze and/or automate processes
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
  • Proven track record of successfully implementing process improvements
  • Proficiency in data analysis and process mapping tools
  • Strong project management skills


It would be a plus if you also have:

  • Previous experience working on an operational role.
  • Certification in process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Kaizen

Title: Knowledge Analyst
Description:
Knowledge Analyst - Contract - Till End of Year




My client is a not-for-profit entity who are key to the successful running of the electricity in the UK. They are vital to the operation of the wholesale electricity market and a trusted, independent and reliable market expert. They are seeking a Knowledge Analyst to support them with readiness for the introduction of a transformation programme which will help them move systems to a more accurate and efficient energy usage measurement system.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to define and deliver knowledge content required for Market Participant readiness.
Conduct knowledge audits to identify, organise, and categorise existing knowledge assets.
Work with business, IT, and data teams to align information architecture with organisational goals.
Develop and implement knowledge management processes, ensuring compliance with best practices.
Assist in creating and delivering knowledge materials, driving self-service adoption and customer journey efficiency.
Oversee the transition of knowledge content to 'business as usual' teams post-implementation.

Requirements:

Experience in the energy sector and customer-focused transformation (desirable but not essential).
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Proficient in knowledge management systems and information categorisation.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
Degree or vocational qualification in information science, computer science, or a related field.
Strong organisational skills and ability to manage complex workloads.

Personal Attributes:

Proactive, logical thinker with a hands-on approach.
Strong attention to detail and outcome-driven focus.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-intensity environment.

Apply today to play a key role in this transformative programme!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Category Development
Description:
At Gopuff, we‚Äôre not just delivering convenience‚Äîwe‚Äôre redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we‚Äôve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst in the Category Development team, you will support the rapid growth of our business by analysing our huge datasets to uncover insights that drive improvements across our category & supply chain performance.

You‚Äôll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo, and make high-impact recommendations. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won‚Äôt just support decisions‚Äîyou‚Äôll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance‚Äîjust a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you‚Äôre a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let‚Äôs go. üöÄ

You Will:


Develop innovative measurement and analytical approaches that build our understanding of performance and customers, embedding these learnings into the Category & In-Stock team's day-to-day decision making.
Answer complex business questions through detailed quantitative analysis and experimentation, extracting meaningful and actionable insights.
Influence both strategic and tactical decision-making in our EU Leadership and Category Management teams through strong communication, and by proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
Build the necessary models and tools to inform our pricing strategies, helping Category Managers maintain a competitive position versus our competitors while maximising margin opportunity.
Provide clear insight into the value and success of different buying policies we have built into our Stock Ordering Tool to ensure we are hitting the target levels of Waste and Availability.
Partner with our Customer Insights team, supporting them with their customer and competitor research projects and helping to embed learnings into the Category teams.
Partner with our MFC Operations team to ensure that inventory compliance reporting & capacity tooling are providing In-Stock team with correct insights they can use to adjust their buying decisions.
Proactively build and nurture a culture of data-driven decision making through coaching & supporting teams to increase their data literacy and confidence.


You Have:


3-5 years of experience in analytics or data science - preferably in fields related to grocery, trading, supply chain.
A strong understanding of statistical analysis and experiment design.
Expert skills in SQL / Python, able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets.
Experience with dbt is a strong plus
Development experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI.
Experience with Looker and LookML in particular is strongly preferred.
A strong and confident communication style, with good knowledge of data visualization and storytelling.
A high degree of curiosity, comfortable gathering and analyzing large amounts of data across a variety of business dimensions.


Benefits:


Company RSU‚Äôs (Company Shares)
Private Medical + Dental cover
Annual performance appraisal and bonus
Employee Discount + FAM membership
Career growth opportunities


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it‚Äîstuff happens. But that‚Äôs where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we‚Äôre assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you‚Äôre hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Zoopla
Description:
At Zoopla, we're here to help everyone make intelligent decisions about their home. Do the best work of your life!

We're a part of Houseful, home to trusted brands Zoopla, Alto, Hometrack, Calcasa and Prime Location. Together we're creating the connections that power better property decisions by unlocking the combined strength of software, data and insight.

We make moves with head and heart to achieve our big ambitions and to drive progress in the property market. There's never been a better time to join us.

Position Overview

Every month millions of people visit Zoopla searching over 500,000 homes for sale and rent, finding the best agents and securing the latest mortgage deals looking for help on one of the biggest decisions in life. Where's my next home going to be?

We want to help even more people make better property decisions, and that's why we care so much about data. Whether someone is looking for their next home or an estate agent is looking to list, we need a best-in-class journey for both. Measurement, experimentation, and insights are the keys to unlocking this.

Responsibilities


Taking ownership of the data relationship with business stakeholders
With support from the rest of the Analytics team
Reporting on our baseline performance and trends. Keeping our finger on the pulse
Driving us towards a self-serve first culture
Reporting on complex experimentation
Close analyst-stakeholder relationships are the most crucial component of a well-functioning data team. Stakeholders should consider you part of their team
Varied work across other data disciplines, e.g. dashboarding, AE modelling, business unit level deep dives and data sprints, supporting ML projects
We make time for innovation, so if you have an idea, shout, and we'll make the space


Requirements


What does a great candidate look like


Experience analysing pricing strategies. For example competitive pricing, value based pricing, and penetration pricing
Demonstrates curiosity and a proactive approach to learning, constantly seeking opportunities to deepen understanding and explore new ideas
Exhibits a strong desire for ownership and accountability, taking the initiative to drive projects forward and deliver impactful results
Skilled at translating complex business challenges into actionable data insights, driving meaningful outcomes and business impact
Excellent communication skills, able to convey ideas clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
While recognising the value of experience, greater emphasis is placed on finding the right cultural fit and individual capabilities for the role
Strives to set high standards and continually seeks opportunities for personal and team growth, fostering an environment of continuous improvement
Inspired by the prospect of contributing to industry innovation and eager to participate in reimagining the future landscape



Essential

Technical Skills


Proficient in SQL with a proven track record of handling complex data queries and manipulation
Demonstrable experience with Tableau or similar data visualisation tools, including the ability to create insightful and user-friendly dashboards and reports



Desirable


Experience with DBT (Data Build Tool) or similar data transformation technologies, with a keen understanding of data modelling and ETL processes
A background in statistics and/or programming, with the ability to apply statistical methods and algorithms to extract insights from data
Especially surrounding experimentation

Familiarity with machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, preferably in Python, R, or another programming language, enabling the development and implementation of predictive models and data-driven solutions

Benefits


Everyday Flex - greater flexibility over where and when you work
25 days annual leave + extra days for years of service
Day off for volunteering & Digital detox day
Festive Closure - business closed for a period between Christmas and New Year
Cycle to work and electric car schemes
Free Calm App membership
Enhanced Parental leave
Fertility Treatment Financial Support
Group Income Protection and private medical insurance
Gym on-site in London
7.5% pension contribution by the company
Discretionary annual bonus up to 10% of base salary
Talent referral bonus up to ¬£5K
Show more
