Title: Graduate Data Analyst (Visa Sponsoring)
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst (Visa Sponsoring) | SaaS Scale-Up | ¬£40,000 - ¬£50,000 per annum | London, UK




About the Company:

Our client is a rapidly growing SaaS scale-up based in London, employing a team of 50 talented professionals who are passionate about transforming industries through software innovation. They specialise in delivering advanced software solutions tailored to the needs of a diverse, expanding client base. Focused on staying ahead of the curve, the company leverages the latest technologies and fosters a culture of continuous improvement, establishing itself as a frontrunner in the SaaS field.




About the Role:

The Data Analyst role presents an exciting opportunity for individuals interested in data management and analysis. In this position, you‚Äôll be responsible for extracting, cleaning, and analysing large datasets to deliver actionable insights that inform business decisions and contribute to the development of top-tier SaaS products. With comprehensive training and development resources, this role allows you to grow your analytical abilities and become proficient with advanced data tools in a fast-paced, agile setting. The ideal candidate will be highly analytical, detail-focused, and eager to drive data-informed decisions.




Responsibilities:

Extracting data from primary and secondary sources, then reorganizing this data in a format that can be easily read by either human or machine.
Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Collaborating with engineering and product development teams to implement and refine data collection techniques.
Assisting in the design and implementation of databases and data collection systems.
Ensuring data integrity and accuracy in all analytics activities.
Participating in ongoing education and training to stay abreast of industry developments and advancements in data analysis tools and techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field is required.
Experience with data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Proficiency with statistical analysis tools (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R) and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.




Benefits:

A competitive salary range of ¬£40,000 to ¬£50,000 with potential for bonuses.
Extensive career development opportunities, including significant training in advanced data science techniques and tools.
Access to the latest tools and technologies in data science.
Regular team events, workshops, and networking opportunities.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative Analyst ‚Äì VP/ED | Top-Tier Global Bank | London




A top-tier global bank is seeking an experienced Quantitative Analyst at the VP/ED level to develop and enhance pricing models and risk management strategies for its commodities trading business. This is an exciting opportunity to work closely with front-office teams in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop and implement advanced pricing models for the energy trading business.
Enhance and maintain quant libraries used for derivatives pricing and risk management.
Support traders and risk managers by troubleshooting and refining existing models.
Improve and optimize the risk management platform to enhance hedging strategies.
Collaborate with trading, structuring, and technology teams to drive innovation in pricing and risk solutions.




Key Requirements:




Advanced degree (MSc/PhD) in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Quantitative Finance, or Computer Science.
Strong programming skills in Python, with some exposure to C++.
Proven experience in a front-office trading environment.
Deep understanding of derivatives pricing models, risk management, and hedging techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work in a high-pressure environment.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work closely with traders and stakeholders.




Preferred Experience:




Prior experience in commodities trading, particularly in physical and financial power and gas products.




This role offers the opportunity to make a significant impact within a leading financial institution while working on cutting-edge quantitative solutions.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Acxiom‚Äôs is looking for a commercially oriented, forward-thinking Senior Data Analyst who is enthusiastic about helping the world‚Äôs largest brands better understand their customers and activate those insights for increased business outcomes. You will report to the Head of Consulting & Analytics EMEA.


This client facing role - on a key account - requires a deep wealth of analytical, data product and business skills applied through the execution of data-driven analytical solutions in marketing. You understand business use cases and take on responsibility for data analysis and data science solutions through the entire process of customer insights, analytical modelling and reporting using industry leading principles, advanced statistical methodologies and state-of-the-art algorithms i.e. AI / Machine learning.


You are a proactive thought leader with effective communication and presentation skills who is innovative as well as aware of current privacy/compliance laws. Furthermore, you can take part and contribute to the continued growth and partnership of client as key part of a team.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES :


‚Ä¢ This is a full-time client-facing role on Heathrow that requires strong client management skills and sound commercial awareness;

‚Ä¢ Support the Acxiom‚Äôs Heathrow account team, Heathrow marketing teams and Heathrow suppliers/agencies in the tactical planning, co-ordination, execution and optimisation of multi-channel customer and prospect communications. This is a high-volume role, including the measurement, analysis and reporting of 25+ campaigns per month for all CRM activities, working in a highly collaborative and close knit team is essential;

‚Ä¢ Be the proactive analytics leader in enabling Heathrow to truly understand their data and deliver better value from it through data-driven actionable insights and advanced analytical techniques that deliver significant business outcomes;

‚Ä¢ Provide strategic advice to Heathrow on all aspects of data and analytics including best practices, future-proofing solutions and value realization roadmaps;

‚Ä¢ Prepare and present all analytics work and results for internal and client stakeholders; and be able to apply creative thinking to influence others;

‚Ä¢ Define requirements including data sources, statistical methods, and implementation;

‚Ä¢ Own the preparation, creation, communication, completion of all internal and external analytics related documentation for the client;


‚Ä¢ Job Role Specific Skills:

- Detailed knowledge of Acxiom data products

- Data analysis using 1st Party and 3rd Party data

- Fluent programming skills in SQL and R or Python

- Experience in Salesforce Data Cloud and/or other Customer Data Platforms

- Experience in Google Cloud Platform and/or other cloud analytical environments

- Experience in Tableau + other data visualisation tools

- Experience building customer segmentation ‚Äì market, lifestyle, behavioural, attitudinal, geographical, etc.

- Experience in propensity and predictive modelling i.e. Next Best Action

‚Ä¢ Ability to both an integral team player and work independently to follow a project through the development lifecycle;

‚Ä¢ Working closely with the Acxiom EMEA analytics team to improve performance and provide subject matter expertise on thought leadership initiatives;

‚Ä¢ Excellent end-user communication skills;

‚Ä¢ Excellent presentation skills; and

‚Ä¢ Ability to mentor others.


SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS


‚Ä¢ Experience in leading analytical projects and client relationships;

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in crafting, building, and delivering analytical solutions serving the biggest brands in business;

‚Ä¢ Expert knowledge of data quality, identity resolution, database concepts, data management, modeling and analysis;

‚Ä¢ Expertise in data visualization and analytical storytelling, with the ability to translate business needs into analytical strategies;

‚Ä¢ Expert-level knowledge of software for marketing analytics, data science, statistical modelling & ML/AI; and

‚Ä¢ Experience developing customer and market segmentations for paid and owned media activation.

‚Ä¢ Fluent in English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salesforce/ Data Analyst ‚Äì Ecommerce | Hybrid (2-3 days in London office)







A well-recognised leading technology company based in London is seeking a Data Analyst to join its Business Intelligence (BI) team. The BI team plays a crucial role in providing advanced analytics, data modelling, and cutting-edge data visualisation to generate strategic insights that drive business decisions.




This is an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic, engaging, and collaborative environment alongside a fantastic team.

Develop actionable insights and communicate key learnings to global business stakeholders.
Perform data maintenance, process reviews, and data quality checks across CRM systems (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud) and external data sources.

Proficiency in Salesfoce
Knowledge of SQL and/or SOQL.
Experience using Tableau (or similar data visualisation tools).
Background in CRM marketing or data management (preferable).
Strong working knowledge of Excel.

What We Offer:

Flexible working (hybrid model ‚Äì 2-3 days in London office).
Competitive salary & benefits package.




A fantastic opportunity to work in a collaborative and innovative environment.

For more information, please contact info@freshtechit.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: SC Cleared Data Analyst

Location: London (Onsite 3 days per week)

Contract Type: 3-month contract with potential for extension

Rate: ¬£400 per day (Inside IR35)

Role Overview

We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our team in a client-facing, data-driven role. The successful candidate will work on an AWS infrastructure-based data platform, focusing on reviewing, correcting, and separating inaccurate or merged data. This role involves working with confidential information and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Key Responsibilities

Data Integrity: Review and correct inaccurate identities across various systems to ensure accurate data representation.
Workload Management: Independently manage workloads to meet deadlines while balancing conflicting priorities.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to deliver high-quality results.
Analytical Thinking: Objectively assess complex information from multiple sources to draw meaningful conclusions.
Technical Application: Utilise Python scripting, Atlassian toolsets and other technologies to perform data corrections and analysis.
Confidentiality: Handle sensitive and confidential information in a secure and professional manner.

Required Skills and Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret and process complex datasets.
Proficiency in Python scripting for automation and data manipulation.
Familiarity with AWS infrastructure and related tools.
Experience working with sensitive data in compliance with regulations.
Excellent communication skills for engaging with clients and stakeholders.
Ability to adapt quickly to changing circumstances and prioritise tasks effectively.

  • Proficiency in Python scripting for automation and data manipulation.
  • Familiarity with AWS infrastructure and related tools.
  • Experience working with sensitive data in compliance with regulations.
  • Excellent communication skills for engaging with clients and stakeholders.
  • Ability to adapt quickly to changing circumstances and prioritise tasks effectively.

Title: Data Analyst - Subscriptions
Description:
Data Analyst - Subscriptions & Analytics - Power BI




Location: Central London




Compensation: ¬£50,000 - ¬£70,000 + Benefits




Type: Permanent




Are you ready to propel your career to new heights with a dynamic digital company who are truly value driven ? We're on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst who boasts a solid background in subscriptions and audience insights. If you're adept with Power BI and have a passion for turning data into actionable intelligence, we want to hear from you!




What You‚Äôll Do:




Join a vibrant team where you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in enhancing our subscriptions business. Your responsibilities will span a diverse range of tasks in an agile, fast-paced environment:




Harness data analysis to drive subscription growth initiatives.
Design and implement sophisticated data models for seamless automated reporting.
Analyze and refine audience segments to tailor our offerings.
Create engaging and insightful Power BI reports, while continually enhancing existing ones.
Ensure the integrity and flow of data and analytics within our systems.
Collaborate with product and audience stakeholders to refine data needs and insights.




Key Qualifications:




Proven experience in data and audience analytics, particularly in Power BI development.
Proficient in Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or similar tools.
Strong familiarity with marketing metrics and data from social media platforms.
Expertise in Power BI, including DAX and M for effective data modelling and visualization.
Competent in connecting to both SQL and non-SQL data sources.
Detail-oriented approach with a robust command of SQL for conducting data quality assessments and ad hoc analyses.
Understanding of data migration, ETL processes, and relational data structures.
Excellent communication skills, characterized by confidence and proactivity.
A data-driven mindset with the ability to conceptualize the end-to-end data process.
A degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, science, or computer science is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Responsibilities

Our People Solutions team are looking for bright, enthusiastic and articulate candidates keen to gain experience and start their career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Drive and attention to detail essential.

The successful candidates will be working closely with other analysts to learn the role and to support on the day-to-day needs.

You will be provided with structured and ‚Äòon-the-job‚Äô training, support with professional qualifications.


Manage, cleanse, and interpret internal data as well as client data.
Responsible for monthly uploads of claims and membership data.
Develop internal models.
Develop PowerBI dashboards for internal and external purposes.
Deliver claims forecasts on PMI and assist the actuarial team.
Carry out ad-hoc projects, across all lines of business, to support the business where possible.

Strong interest in programming languages such as DAX/VBA, R/Python
Strong problem-solving skills
Thorough and great attention to detail
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing

Title: Analyst
Description:
Gas Strategies is looking for an ambitious and capable person with an advanced quantitative and analytical ability to join the Consulting Team.




Accurate and precise, with an advanced level of Excel proficiency, the successful candidate will have some experience within the energy industry and will have developed a good understanding of current market dynamics. The role provides the first step on a career path towards a Consultant role in our well-established and successful global professional services consulting firm.




Purpose of Role

Responsible for the delivery of accurate, relevant, and efficient client-focused data analysis, market research, and modelling that exhibits a clarity of understanding of clients‚Äô concerns and supports clients‚Äô commercial decision making. This includes the ability to clearly articulate results and findings, in written and oral presentations, to both colleagues and clients.




Key Performance Indicators & Role Description




Data Modelling

To lead on the building and customisation of economic/commercial models for financial simulation and scenario planning as it pertains to key projects
To support the development and configuration of various in-house tools and models to deliver high value functionality
Develop and improve forecasting/modelling approaches and techniques




Data Management

Use a variety of tasks and methods to organise/analyse data from multiple sources with high degrees of rigour
Use systems and programming knowledge, personal experience, clients‚Äô needs and project goals to provide business decision-making support
Assist with the development and utilisation of Gas Strategies Online products




Data Analysis

Break down issues and tasks into manageable parts in a systematic way and identify relationships between parts
Make the results of analysis understandable, enabling others to buy-in or accept conclusions
Identify, explore, and discuss client needs in order to identify all relevant parameters for inclusion in data models
Discuss and agree the approach to and allocation of project tasks with peers and project managers
Identify data risk elements and assumptions to determine implications and consequences of analysis
Provide technical data modelling assistance to other team members
Understand and interpret underlying research requirements and assumptions in order to identify suitable sources of relevant data
Assist with project delivery through the provision of inputs into presentations and projects
Co-ordinate timely execution and delivery of project outputs as agreed by project timelines




Consulting

Liaise, communicate and network with clients/project leaders to deliver client assignments
Develop good quality project content and reports and oversee quality/evaluation of technical material
Presentation of results and findings to clients




Essential requirements and experience:

Excellent numerate ability with high-level Excel and economic modelling ability
Have a significant background in economic forecasting methods and techniques
Experience of analysing complex data and deriving real business decision support (with tangible benefits to the business)
Have an interest and affinity for the energy and gas industry that is consistent with Gas Strategies Group‚Äôs positioning as a key provider of professional services at the heart of the industry
A team player who relishes the challenge of new experiences and exhibits a willingness to seek out opportunities within the business
Ability to quickly learn new concepts and apply these to the wider business context




Desirable requirements:

Have at least 1-2 years‚Äô experience of the energy industry, preferably within the global gas sector
Some exposure to consulting and client interaction would be advantageous




Personal Attributes:

Demonstrate accuracy and meticulous attention to detail
Strong planning, organisational, and time management skills
Creative problem-solving ability

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our IT team at Harrods. This role will report to the Lead BI Analyst, within the wider Data & Analytics function

About The Role

The role will get involved in all aspects of developing and maintaining a modern and flexible data visualisation layer and reporting solutions. While based in Hammersmith, the role may require occasional visits to the Knightsbridge location and some travel to other Harrods office locations e.g. Thatcham. Working from home will be an option and supported in line with future company policies.

You will also;


Proactively engage with business to design appropriate solutions
Translate the business needs into technical solutions
Build engaging reports and visualizations using company standard tools
Support and resolve data and report issues


About You

The ideal candidate will have previous experience using SAP Analytics Cloud, Business Objects and Analysis for office. It is important to have previous experience in Data warehouse/ Data Lake/ Database experience.

You will also have:


Stakeholder management experience
Strong Data Analysis experience
Project, work with big data, Manipulate and draw conclusions
Experience with Data visualisation tools
Advanced Excel Skills
SQL or Python or R experience is desirable


About Us

As the world‚Äôs leading luxury retail emporium, we craft magic, memorable experiences for our customers and support our talented teams to become the best ambassadors for our global brand. We set the highest standards and reward the remarkable people who help us maintain them

Our Promise to You

Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we‚Äôll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.

In return you‚Äôll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days‚Äô holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.

Uniquely You

Whilst our job adverts outline the ideal qualities, skills, and prior experience for the role, we believe in the potential for growth and value individual strengths. If you can demonstrate the majority of skills and strong experience to thrive in this role, we would encourage you to apply.

At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.

If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì AI & Ad Performance Insights

¬£45,000 - ¬£55,000 base

‚ÄºÔ∏èLocation: Office-based (4 days per week near Liverpool St, London), with flexibility for customer and prospect meetings.




An innovative AI-driven SaaS company is looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join their team and play a key role in transforming digital advertising. This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of data, AI, and product strategy, with a clear path to Product Ownership.




What You'll Do

Automate and enhance prospect account analysis to accelerate deal cycles
Assess digital advertising accounts using commercial, industry, and AI adoption insights
Develop Python-based analytics to measure performance and AI effectiveness
Standardise key metrics for paid media efficiency, AI scoring, and industry benchmarking
Build automation pipelines to reduce manual analysis and surface insights instantly
Work with engineers to productise automated performance assessments
Engage with sales and customers to translate data insights into business impact
Influence product direction by identifying AI automation and reporting opportunities




What We‚Äôre Looking For

1 year+ technical Skills: Python, SQL, data visualisation (they use Shiny, but open to Looker, Tablaeau, matplotlib)
Communication: Ability to present insights and bridge technical analysis with commercial goals - storytelling and gravitas.
Ad-Tech & Analytics: Experience with Google Ads APIs, marketing automation, or SaaS analytics

Added bonus for:

AI & Product Thinking: Passion for AI-driven decision-making and structured analytical models
SaaS B2B start up exposure.




Why Join

Pathway to Product Ownership ‚Äì grow from data analyst to AI-driven product leader
Hands-on exposure to cutting-edge automation and decision intelligence
Work across Product, Sales, and Engineering in a hybrid, high-impact role
Join a fast-growing, dynamic environment where innovation and collaboration drive success




If you're passionate about AI, analytics, and automation, apply now and be part of the future of AI-driven advertising.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Vinterior

Vinterior is the UK‚Äôs leading marketplace for premium pre-owned furniture, offering a sustainable alternative to brand-new.

Since 2016, we‚Äôve built Europe‚Äôs largest collection of pre-loved pieces, spanning 25 styles and 100 categories, driving a circular economy for furniture. With 14,000 sellers and 400,000+ unique items, Vinterior is the #1 destination for preloved furniture and homeware in the UK.

Backed by top investors like Seedcamp, Venrex, Active Partners, and Channel 4 Ventures, we‚Äôve raised ¬£16 million to date. This funding will fuel our expansion as we aim to become Europe‚Äôs leading pre-owned furniture platform within three years.

About The Role

The objective of the role is to uncover insights that will help Vinterior find and prioritise the best opportunities to grow GMV (gross merchandise value, the total value of sales made on our platform) and revenues (Vinterior‚Äôs revenue from commission, fees and other sources), and to evaluate tests and initiatives that are launched to make the best decisions about them.

You‚Äôll run your own analysis projects but also keep our analytical tools working well, supporting the wider team in running their own analyses and expanding our data models as the business changes.

This role reports directly to the Chief Product and Technology Officer, but day-to-day will work with all functions in the business: product, supply, brand, CX and finance.

This role is remote, preferably in the UK but Europe on UK timezones works too. Some travel to London and/or other European cities will be required for offsites, once or twice a year.

Core Responsibilities:

The key responsibility of the role is to use data analysis to uncover and evaluate growth opportunities for Vinterior, while helping the wider team use our data tooling for their own analyses.


Customer and commercial insights
Further Vinterior's understanding of its customers and generate growth hypotheses from this understanding, using customer surveys, feedback tools and qualitative methods in addition to data analysis
Conduct regular analysis of the inventory on Vinterior and what type of inventory is driving sales
Analyse opportunities to grow revenues


Product analysis


Support the Senior Product Manager with analysis to inform product strategy and feature development
Conduct deep-dive analysis on the results of product tests and exepriments, and website changes, to understand their impact and share these results with the wider team


Data and BI management


Manage and maintain our Looker instance, adding new data models as
Support and train the wider team to run their own analyses using Looker, Looker Studio, Amplitude and other tools


User acquisition and retention analysis


Analyse the effectiveness of user acquisition activity (marketing channels)
Help the business understand repeat purchase behaviour and customer lifetime value, making recommendations on how to improve it


Strategic expansion opportunities


Perform analysis to evaluate opportunities such as international or category expansion.


Requirements

Qualifications:


You have at least 2+ years experience in an analyst role, in house at a digital and consumer focused company or with a consulting firm, ideally with a business growth focus


Who you are:


You are customer-focussed in your thinking and have a deep natural curiosity for how customers think and behave
You're exceptionally numerate and analytical; you have a strong academic record in maths and can demonstrate your skill across the full scope of analytical projects: defining objectives, designing and structuring analysis, methodology selection and execution, interpreting and communicating results
You have advanced skills in excel/sheets, comfortable using BI tools (e.g. Looker) and web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Amplitude)
You have strong coding skills for data analysis ‚Äì SQL for analysis essential, Python desirable
You have experience and aptitude in survey design and qualitative analysis in addition to quantitative data analysis
You're excited about an independent analyst role with a broad scope, and passionate about helping Vinterior grow its business


Benefits

Why join us?

Work directly with the leadership team of a high-growth, mission-driven startup.

Be a part of something impactful: championing sustainability and shaping the future of furniture resale

Grow with us: This role offers unmatched learning opportunities in a fast-paced environment, with hands-on exposure to all areas of business. You‚Äôll have access to mentorship from experienced executives and the opportunity to shape your role as the company grows.

Inclusive culture: We welcome diverse perspectives and celebrate the uniqueness of our team members

Benefits:


Annual Leave: 25 days of paid leave in addition to 8 bank holidays
Tenure Gift: You will receive additional paid leave for 1+ years of service to the company.
Private Medical Insurance: Comprehensive private medical insurance coverage to ensure your well-being (dependent on role/contract)
Co-working Allowance: A monthly allowance of ¬£150 for co-working and office space access (dependent on role/contract)
Health and Well-being Allowance: A monthly allowance of ¬£50 for health and well-being expenses (dependent on role/contract)
ThanksBen Flexible Benefits Platform: Our flexible benefits platform offers various options, including a pension scheme. The employer contribution is 3% of your salary, while the employee contribution is 5%. We use NEST as a Pension provider (dependent onrole/contract)
Charity Days: You will receive paid leave to support your chosen charity and make a positive impact on the community.
Employee Vinterior Discount: Enjoy a special discount on Vinterior products as an employee of Vinterior.


Please note that all benefits are subject to the terms and conditions outlined in our employee handbook.

Our Company Values:

Our interview process looks for people who share our company values.

If these principles resonate with you and describe the kinds of people you would like to work with, then you are likely to enjoy and thrive in the working culture at Vinterior

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion

At Vinterior, we believe that diversity is our strength. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and are committed to providing a fair and inclusive hiring process. If you don‚Äôt meet every requirement but are passionate about our mission, we encourage you to apply. Let us know if you need any adjustments during the application process to support your application.

Ready to apply?

InInterested in helping us shape the future of furniture? Apply now by submitting your CV and a short cover letter outlining why you‚Äôre excited about this role and what you can bring to Vinterior.

No recruitment consultants please. Visa Sponsorship not available.

Our hiring process


Initial Screening ‚Äì You'll start with a conversation with our CPTO or COS to learn more about your experience and ensure a strong fit with our team.
Case Study ‚Äì You‚Äôll complete a case study to showcase your analytical and SQL skills and present your solutions to our CPTO.
Culture fit interview ‚Äì You'll meet with our team to dive deeper into your culture fit.
CEO & Founder Meeting ‚Äì A one-on-one meeting with our CEO and Founder to discuss your vision and alignment with our mission.


We aim to move swiftly and ensure a smooth, engaging process throughout.
Show more

Work directly with the leadership team of a high-growth, mission-driven startup.

Be a part of something impactful: championing sustainability and shaping the future of furniture resale

Grow with us: This role offers unmatched learning opportunities in a fast-paced environment, with hands-on exposure to all areas of business. You‚Äôll have access to mentorship from experienced executives and the opportunity to shape your role as the company grows.

Inclusive culture: We welcome diverse perspectives and celebrate the uniqueness of our team members

Benefits:

  • Annual Leave: 25 days of paid leave in addition to 8 bank holidays
  • Tenure Gift: You will receive additional paid leave for 1+ years of service to the company.
  • Private Medical Insurance: Comprehensive private medical insurance coverage to ensure your well-being (dependent on role/contract)
  • Co-working Allowance: A monthly allowance of ¬£150 for co-working and office space access (dependent on role/contract)
  • Health and Well-being Allowance: A monthly allowance of ¬£50 for health and well-being expenses (dependent on role/contract)
  • ThanksBen Flexible Benefits Platform: Our flexible benefits platform offers various options, including a pension scheme. The employer contribution is 3% of your salary, while the employee contribution is 5%. We use NEST as a Pension provider (dependent onrole/contract)
  • Charity Days: You will receive paid leave to support your chosen charity and make a positive impact on the community.
  • Employee Vinterior Discount: Enjoy a special discount on Vinterior products as an employee of Vinterior.

Please note that all benefits are subject to the terms and conditions outlined in our employee handbook.

Our Company Values:

Our interview process looks for people who share our company values.

If these principles resonate with you and describe the kinds of people you would like to work with, then you are likely to enjoy and thrive in the working culture at Vinterior

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion

At Vinterior, we believe that diversity is our strength. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and are committed to providing a fair and inclusive hiring process. If you don‚Äôt meet every requirement but are passionate about our mission, we encourage you to apply. Let us know if you need any adjustments during the application process to support your application.

Ready to apply?

InInterested in helping us shape the future of furniture? Apply now by submitting your CV and a short cover letter outlining why you‚Äôre excited about this role and what you can bring to Vinterior.

No recruitment consultants please. Visa Sponsorship not available.

Our hiring process

  • Initial Screening ‚Äì You'll start with a conversation with our CPTO or COS to learn more about your experience and ensure a strong fit with our team.
  • Case Study ‚Äì You‚Äôll complete a case study to showcase your analytical and SQL skills and present your solutions to our CPTO.
  • Culture fit interview ‚Äì You'll meet with our team to dive deeper into your culture fit.
  • CEO & Founder Meeting ‚Äì A one-on-one meeting with our CEO and Founder to discuss your vision and alignment with our mission.

We aim to move swiftly and ensure a smooth, engaging process throughout.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join us as a Data Analyst within the CDAO (Chief Data and Analytics Office) team at Barclays, where you'll drive innovation through data-driven solutions and contribute to challenging the status quo. In this role, you'll collaborate with Functional and Technical Leads, as well as a wide range of stakeholders, to perform in-depth business and root cause data analysis. You‚Äôll focus on solving complex business problems related to data quality, lineage, controls and authoritative sources. By working with large data sets and performing logical data modelling, you'll simplify complex issues, drive impactful solutions and ensure alignment across both functional and cross-functional teams for successful delivery.

To be successful as a Data Analyst, you should have:



Experience in business/data analysis, generating outputs that provide clear insights to stakeholders.
Competence in using SQL for querying databases and manipulating data, with a focus on accuracy and attention to detail.
Foundational skills in data modelling and the ability to understand and deliver clear requirements for data-related projects.



Some Other Highly Valued Skills May Include



Understanding the importance of data quality and basic techniques for ensuring reliable data.
Proficiency in using Excel and other basic analytical tools for data analysis and reporting.
Familiarity with investment banking products and services, with an ability to understand the impact of changes on different areas.



You may be assessed on the key critical skills relevant for success in role, such as risk and controls, change and transformation, business acumen, strategic thinking and digital and technology, as well as job-specific technical skills.

This role is hybrid and based in London.

Purpose of the role

To implement data quality process and procedures, ensuring that data is reliable and trustworthy, then extract actionable insights from it to help the organisation improve its operation, and optimise resources.

Accountabilities



Investigation and analysis of data issues related to quality, lineage, controls, and authoritative source identification.
Execution of data cleansing and transformation tasks to prepare data for analysis.
Designing and building data pipelines to automate data movement and processing.
Development and application of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning and AI, to solve complex business problems.
Documentation of data quality findings and recommendations for improvement.



Assistant Vice President Expectations



To advise and influence decision making, contribute to policy development and take responsibility for operational effectiveness. Collaborate closely with other functions/ business divisions.
Lead a team performing complex tasks, using well developed professional knowledge and skills to deliver on work that impacts the whole business function. Set objectives and coach employees in pursuit of those objectives, appraisal of performance relative to objectives and determination of reward outcomes
If the position has leadership responsibilities, People Leaders are expected to demonstrate a clear set of leadership behaviours to create an environment for colleagues to thrive and deliver to a consistently excellent standard. The four LEAD behaviours are: L ‚Äì Listen and be authentic, E ‚Äì Energise and inspire, A ‚Äì Align across the enterprise, D ‚Äì Develop others.
OR for an individual contributor, they will lead collaborative assignments and guide team members through structured assignments, identify the need for the inclusion of other areas of specialisation to complete assignments. They will identify new directions for assignments and/ or projects, identifying a combination of cross functional methodologies or practices to meet required outcomes.
Consult on complex issues; providing advice to People Leaders to support the resolution of escalated issues.
Identify ways to mitigate risk and developing new policies/procedures in support of the control and governance agenda.
Take ownership for managing risk and strengthening controls in relation to the work done.
Perform work that is closely related to that of other areas, which requires understanding of how areas coordinate and contribute to the achievement of the objectives of the organisation sub-function.
Collaborate with other areas of work, for business aligned support areas to keep up to speed with business activity and the business strategy.
Engage in complex analysis of data from multiple sources of information, internal and external sources such as procedures and practises (in other areas, teams, companies, etc).to solve problems creatively and effectively.
Communicate complex information. 'Complex' information could include sensitive information or information that is difficult to communicate because of its content or its audience.
Influence or convince stakeholders to achieve outcomes.



All colleagues will be expected to demonstrate the Barclays Values of Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship ‚Äì our moral compass, helping us do what we believe is right. They will also be expected to demonstrate the Barclays Mindset ‚Äì to Empower, Challenge and Drive ‚Äì the operating manual for how we behave.

Location: London, United Kingdom (Hybrid)

Contract Length: 5 months Rolling

Day rate: ¬£500 to ¬£580 Inside IR35




Key Requirements:

Exceptional Communication Skills ‚Äì Strong verbal and written communication with stakeholders across Business and Technology teams.
Asset Management Expertise ‚Äì Significant experience in data analysis and solution design within asset management
Data Domain Knowledge ‚Äì Extensive understanding of asset management data, including:
Experience Working with Data Suppliers / Outsourcers

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We‚Äôre more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We‚Äôre growing fast: Our community of 113 million registered users and 240,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 419+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.132.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation. We are also ready to consider candidates with more work experience as Senior Data Analyst.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go‚Äôs most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond Marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you‚Äôre passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or a strong appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You have econometric modeling experience; familiarity with marketing mix models (MMM) is a plus.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product, mainly based in our HQ in Copenhagen.
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly. Our London office is located in Shoreditch.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We are RAPP ‚Äì world leaders in activating growth with precision and empathy at scale. As a global, next-generation precision marketing agency we leverage data, creativity, technology, and empathy to foster client growth. We champion individuality in the marketing solutions we create, and in our workplace. We fight for solutions that adapt to the individual‚Äôs needs, beliefs, behaviours, and aspirations. We foster an inclusive workplace that values diversity and emphasises personal well-being.

MARKETING SCIENCES

The Marketing Sciences team at RAPP is a driving force behind the agency's success, harnessing the power of data and technology. We are superconnectors, bridging the gap between creativity, data and tech to unlock limitless possibilities and disruption.

Our mission is to provide deep insights and a true robust understanding of our clients' businesses and marketing challenges. Our expertise is to empower our agency and the client to make data-driven decisions that directly impact performance and drive measurable results.

From identifying the untapped value of client data to expanding its potential through data capture, rigorous analysis, and statistical techniques, we leave no stone unturned. We are split into 4 disciplines in Marketing Sciences; Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Enablement and Data Visualisation to enable us to deliver against any client data driven challenge.

Together, we will revolutionize the way data is utilised, ensuring that every action we take contributes to the success of our clients and propels the agency forward. Welcome to a future where data and technology and your ideas push the boundaries of what's possible.

YOUR ROLE

In the Data Analytics team you will ensure both the voice of the customer and CFO are represented in the room with hard evidence. As well as supporting exceptional customer experiences using data, you will help ensure every action we take is directly improving performance against your clients objectives.

As an Analyst, you will work under supervision to deliver projects within set deadlines, utilisng your strong hands on analytical capabilities. Your strengths in Python and SQL will ensure you can efficiently deliver robust analytics with guidance from your team.

Your experience with web and social analytics tools (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr) and data visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc) will enable you to uncover key insights across channels and create self-service dashboards.

You will be comfortable working as part of a team with supervision from seniors, whilst being able to execute analysis independently.

Whilst no two days will look the same, you‚Äôll be sharing findings back to more senior members of the team to shape for articulation to clients.

Under the guidance of senior members of the team you support answering strategic questions using data and forge an understanding of how to deliver personalisation at scale.

In Data Analytics you won‚Äôt be expected to build advanced segmentations and data science models, but you will develop an understanding of the art of the possible with data science, the necessary data required to fuel models and an ability to spot where a business challenge would be best supported through automation or leveraging the latest modelling techniques.

You will have a developing interest with the omni-channel landscape and be able to develop a strong understanding of how to capture and utilise data across channels, from creating tagging and taxonomy to measurement with web analytics tools.

Once you join the team, you will be onboarded to our product suite and playbooks and be capable of articulating and following these best-in-class approaches.

The ideal candidate is ready to jump in. Find problems. Fix them. Build relationships. Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.

Your Responsibilities

Management


You will be mentored to understand how to become a manager
You will follow the direction of your line manager and manage upwards when needed


Client


Understanding clients‚Äô objectives, their business and KPIs and step change their businesses through the power of data
Deliver and understand the role of the work briefed to you
Challenge the briefs and ambition of the work
Build relationships with analysts client side
Support the creation of best-in-class, statistically significant, measurement and reporting
Collaborate in a results-driven, test, learn and optimisation culture for the client
Communicate analytical outputs
Ensure deliverables are completed on time and learn to deliver presentation quality
Follow robust, scalable and efficient processes for delivery


New Business / PR


Be aware of our new business pitches and work we are doing
Participate in thought pieces / case studies / award entries showing off your work to the industry


Network


Understand our network and other players within it


Evolution


Focus on your constant evolution - Show a desire to learn and develop core analytical skills
Understand your strengths and weaknesses and train accordingly


Your Skills And Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative subject (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or Social Sciences, with heavy emphasis on quantitative methods; Master‚Äôs degree or PHD is a plus. Degree will not be required with appropriate work experience.
1 ‚Äì 2 years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, customer experience insights, performance optimization, ideally in a marketing agency or management consulting practice.
You will be expected to have an understanding and with guidance utilise our core technical skills:
Core analytical languages and software (Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx)
Statistics
Data Visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc)
Web and Social Analytics (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr)
Value engineering / Business casing
Performance Measurement and Meaurement Frameworks
Data Protection / GDPR
Customer journey analysis and planning
Brief planning and writing
Progressive data capture
Segmentation and Modelling
Martech design and ecosystem tracking (tagging and taxonomy)
Developing knowledge of experimental / multivariate test design techniques.
Growing knowledge of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data
Confident, conscientious, self-starter, a good work ethic, and capable of building good working relationships with clients as well as other team members.
Naturally curious, imaginative and have a practical approach to problem solving.
Experience jumping in, finding problems across data and process, and fixing them.
Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.

From identifying the untapped value of client data to expanding its potential through data capture, rigorous analysis, and statistical techniques, we leave no stone unturned. We are split into 4 disciplines in Marketing Sciences; Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Enablement and Data Visualisation to enable us to deliver against any client data driven challenge.

Together, we will revolutionize the way data is utilised, ensuring that every action we take contributes to the success of our clients and propels the agency forward. Welcome to a future where data and technology and your ideas push the boundaries of what's possible.

YOUR ROLE

In the Data Analytics team you will ensure both the voice of the customer and CFO are represented in the room with hard evidence. As well as supporting exceptional customer experiences using data, you will help ensure every action we take is directly improving performance against your clients objectives.

As an Analyst, you will work under supervision to deliver projects within set deadlines, utilisng your strong hands on analytical capabilities. Your strengths in Python and SQL will ensure you can efficiently deliver robust analytics with guidance from your team.

Your experience with web and social analytics tools (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr) and data visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc) will enable you to uncover key insights across channels and create self-service dashboards.

You will be comfortable working as part of a team with supervision from seniors, whilst being able to execute analysis independently.

Whilst no two days will look the same, you‚Äôll be sharing findings back to more senior members of the team to shape for articulation to clients.

Under the guidance of senior members of the team you support answering strategic questions using data and forge an understanding of how to deliver personalisation at scale.

In Data Analytics you won‚Äôt be expected to build advanced segmentations and data science models, but you will develop an understanding of the art of the possible with data science, the necessary data required to fuel models and an ability to spot where a business challenge would be best supported through automation or leveraging the latest modelling techniques.

You will have a developing interest with the omni-channel landscape and be able to develop a strong understanding of how to capture and utilise data across channels, from creating tagging and taxonomy to measurement with web analytics tools.

Once you join the team, you will be onboarded to our product suite and playbooks and be capable of articulating and following these best-in-class approaches.

The ideal candidate is ready to jump in. Find problems. Fix them. Build relationships. Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.

Your Responsibilities

Management

  • You will be mentored to understand how to become a manager
  • You will follow the direction of your line manager and manage upwards when needed

Client

  • Understanding clients‚Äô objectives, their business and KPIs and step change their businesses through the power of data
  • Deliver and understand the role of the work briefed to you
  • Challenge the briefs and ambition of the work
  • Build relationships with analysts client side
  • Support the creation of best-in-class, statistically significant, measurement and reporting
  • Collaborate in a results-driven, test, learn and optimisation culture for the client
  • Communicate analytical outputs
  • Ensure deliverables are completed on time and learn to deliver presentation quality
  • Follow robust, scalable and efficient processes for delivery

New Business / PR

  • Be aware of our new business pitches and work we are doing
  • Participate in thought pieces / case studies / award entries showing off your work to the industry

Network

  • Understand our network and other players within it

Evolution

  • Focus on your constant evolution - Show a desire to learn and develop core analytical skills
  • Understand your strengths and weaknesses and train accordingly

Your Skills And Experience

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative subject (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or Social Sciences, with heavy emphasis on quantitative methods; Master‚Äôs degree or PHD is a plus. Degree will not be required with appropriate work experience.
  • 1 ‚Äì 2 years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, customer experience insights, performance optimization, ideally in a marketing agency or management consulting practice.
  • You will be expected to have an understanding and with guidance utilise our core technical skills:
    • Core analytical languages and software (Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx)
    • Statistics
    • Data Visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc)
    • Web and Social Analytics (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr)
    • Value engineering / Business casing
    • Performance Measurement and Meaurement Frameworks
    • Data Protection / GDPR
    • Customer journey analysis and planning
    • Brief planning and writing
    • Progressive data capture
    • Segmentation and Modelling
    • Martech design and ecosystem tracking (tagging and taxonomy)
  • Developing knowledge of experimental / multivariate test design techniques.
  • Growing knowledge of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data
  • Confident, conscientious, self-starter, a good work ethic, and capable of building good working relationships with clients as well as other team members.
  • Naturally curious, imaginative and have a practical approach to problem solving.
  • Experience jumping in, finding problems across data and process, and fixing them.
  • Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
  • Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.

Title: Data Analyst, London
Description:
We are actively seeking an exceptional individual to join our London team as a Data Analyst to support our product and digital marketing functions.

Humatica is the award-winning leading specialist advisor helping private equity funds and entrepreneurial portfolio company leaders to build strong organisations that deliver value growth.

Working with hundreds of portfolio companies for over 20 years, we have codified the management practices and operating models that drive value creation. Our unique tools, services and data enable organizations to achieve audacious goals.

We work across all industries predominantly in Europe, but also in North America and Asia Pacific, with offices in London, Paris, Munich and Zurich.

We are looking for an entrepreneurial person who shares our passion for building best in class products and services in private equity.

A role with exposure to a range of data-driven business analysis and multiple career path avenues.

Your Role

Humatica products


Delivery of the Humatica products (altus and modas) involving set-up, administration and results analysis in support of the consulting teams
Ownership of the delivery process, training other team members after own experience is developed
Support the Product Manager in documenting roadmap items & conducting testing to ensure releases are client-ready
Support the design and development of underlying database structures


Sales, Marketing & Business Intelligence


Support design, development and maintenance of internal and external Business Intelligence dashboards, including product & marketing performance
Support the Marketing Manager in the monitoring of Marketing communications and campaigns
Rigorously manage CRM/database updates and changes, maintaining a high-level of data quality
Support the Marketing Manager with gathering and leveraging market intelligence to enhance Business Development efforts
Support the Product Manager and Marketing Manager with key data analytics to inform business decisions
Ensure GDPR compliant data governance practices are adhered to


Your Profile


Min 2 years‚Äô experience in a relevant data analytics / business intelligence role
Keen interest in Business Analysis, Product Development and/or Marketing Automation
Extensive experience with PowerBI and other BI tools
Experience with CRM & Analytics tools (preferably Hubspot & Google Analytics)
Experience with SQL DB design / DB management
Experience in analytical modelling
Ideally degree in business analytics, mathematics, or similar technical subject


Our Offer


Award-winning boutique consultancy
Competitive, performance-based compensation
Engaged leadership with clear focus on your personal development
Being part of a diverse, dynamic team
New, entrepreneurial growth challenges in an innovative and rapidly developing sector
Attractive work location in London
Flexible remote and office working

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Simply Business helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




Simply Business is an online business insurance brokerage that specialises in one thing: protecting the businesses their customers are working hard to build. Since they started life in 2005, they have helped over three million small businesses and self-employed people find the protection that‚Äôs right for them, from builders to bakers and personal trainers. Their big idea was to reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible, while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that they believe small businesses and landlords are entitled to.




Their story - continued commitment to doing the right thing




2005 seems like a long time ago. Simply Business ‚Äì a small company with a big idea. To transform the way that other small businesses could get the insurance that they need. To reduce time, hassle and jargon wherever possible while introducing the simplicity, choice and value that small businesses are entitled to. To protect them from harm. To keep their livelihoods safe. And to do all this with the promise of positive service. Delivered by happy people, working flexibly, learning constantly. With a restlessly innovative spirit. Within a business committed to doing the right thing. All of the time.




As they've grown, they've tried hard to keep true to this. To ourselves, to their 800 strong team and to the 3.5m customers that they've served so far. And as they move forward, as they enter a big new market, as they grow responsibly, as they improve their products, as they offer their customers more of what they need, of what they deserve, they'll hold onto the focus of that small company with the big idea. Protecting and serving businesses across the UK and the US. From barbers to bakers, consultants to cleaners, they are the backbone of the economy.




And they'll continue to stand by them. Bit by bit helping their dreams grow, just like ours.




Why do they need this role?




This role will sit within the global Data and Analytics team (DNA) in Simply Business. DNA has been central to empowering data-driven decision making at SB. They have invested heavily in their data pipeline, data engineering and their business intelligence capabilities.
In 2023 and beyond, they will continue investing a significant amount of effort in ramping up their Business Intelligence capabilities to drive business decisions.
The primary duty of this role will be to provide analytical support for their business stakeholders. This includes leading the measurement and evaluation of their product value streams and ensuring that they continuously improve the effectiveness of their product investments. Success in this role will require you to be a trusted advisor to their business partners, ensuring they focus their efforts on the most value-added insights initiatives.




In this role, you will:




Create data models in their Snowflake data warehouse
Integrate new sources of data to enrich their analytical capabilities
Work with the engineering and product teams to ensure application design accommodates reporting and analytics requirements
Work with various business and engineering teams to ensure reliable, scalable, robust architecture for their analytics platform and ETL pipelines
Partner with stakeholders to identify business use cases and translate them into the right analytical problem that you will build, test and productionize
Particular focus will be on use cases that will help them drive operational efficiencies as the organization scales.
Increase the organization's ability to convert more customers.
Clearly communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences
Contribute to longer term strategic DNA projects




What are they looking for:




At least 3 years of overall experience in data & analytics, operational analytics experience is desired;
Degree with analytics or software engineering experience or equivalent work experience;
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake or similar;
Experience designing and creating SQL data models using dbt (dbt Certification a plus);
Strong communication and data presentation skills through the use of effective data visualisation and BI tools, e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI, etc;
Effective at building strong, influential relationships with colleagues and partners, with demonstrated success in delivering impactful insights to executives;
Self-starter who is comfortable working in a globally distributed team environment
Experience in Python or another programming language (e.g. Kotlin, Scala, Ruby) is welcomed

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
Zeal Group is one of the leading trading platforms with a focus on developing markets and great plans for international expansion.

At the heart of our company's data-driven strategy lies our Business Intelligence team, a specialized group dedicated to the art and science of data analysis. Our team is the backbone in transforming raw data into a treasure trove of insights, guiding the strategic direction of the company. With a laser focus on identifying and building key indicators for crucial areas within the organization, we strive to help key stakeholders in strategic decision-making.

We are a compact team of data analysts and BI engineers, each with a deep understanding of how data shapes business outcomes. Our expertise spans across various domains, enabling us to craft bespoke analytical solutions that meet the unique needs of different departments. From sales and marketing to operations and finance, our work informs strategies, optimizes performance, and uncovers opportunities for growth and innovation.

In our pursuit of excellence, we leverage cutting-edge BI tools and technologies, ensuring our stakeholders access reliable, timely, and actionable data. Our collaborative ethos fosters a culture of shared knowledge and continuous learning, enabling us to push the boundaries of what is possible with data.

As a Data Analyst/BI Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations. Your mission is to delve deep into the analysis of company indicators, unraveling the stories the data tells to empower business decisions, optimize processes, and drive product innovation. You will:


Analyze company indicators to provide actionable business insights and product improvement recommendations
Develop and own business intelligence solutions, including BI/data visualisation tools, dashboards, and reports to meet business needs
Collaborate with stakeholders as a data business partner, understanding and defining business requirements for data assets
Develop and maintain the semantics layers of the data analytics platform through effective data modelling and data orchestration
Ensure data quality and integrity by establishing and enforcing data governance standards
Create and manage documentation, including technical specifications, data catalog, and other related documents for BI processes, systems, and procedures



Requirements


Fluency in SQL is a must (CTE, Window functions)
Hands-on experience with BI tools, Dashboards, and Data Visualizations (Power BI, Metabase or similar tools)
Proven track record of end-to-end implementation of data analysis projects, from gathering requirements and data processing to effectively presenting insights to stakeholders
Proficient in data modeling, building high quality datasets and products


Nice to have


Proficiency in Data Modelling, building high quality datasets and products
Experience in Python
Experience with DBT, Airflow, Dagster or similar tools
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Spark)
Background in online trading or related financial sectors



Benefits


State-of-the-art technologies (Power BI, Metabase, BigQuery, Dagster, DBT, Datahub, Spark, Python, SQL)
A collaborative and friendly team of professionals
High engineering standards (with a focus on change management and data quality)
Flexible schedule and remote friendliness
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Up to ¬£50,000

Hybrid - London

THE COMPANY

Are you passionate about data and eager to make an impact? Join a dynamic team where you'll drive key decisions and contribute to the rapid scaling of a leading consumer credit platform.

As a Data Analyst, you'll work closely with the marketing and CRM teams to monitor and report on campaign performance, analyze AB tests, and deliver valuable insights to improve UX and monetization. You'll also play a crucial role in shaping strategic decisions by providing in-depth analytics to support business growth and product development.

THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

* Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
* Work closely with our marketing teams across acquisition or retention (CRM) to help them understand the benefit of our marketing activity
* Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve our campaigns and user experience
* Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
* Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals

YOUR KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Advanced SQL and Excel skills
Proven track record in marketing analytics/customer analytics
Experience with Domo, Tableau, or other data visualization tools
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
Ability to prioritize and manage workloads effectively
Desire to learn and collaborate with others

THE BENEFITS

Up to ¬£50,000 + benefits
Hybrid
London

HOW TO APPLY

If interested in the role please send your CV to Jordan Victor via the Apply Link below

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Business Process Optimization Specialist

London - Hybrid

Permanent

¬£55,000 - ¬£61,000 p/a




The Background

We are partnered with an innovative IT consultancy based in London but with a global presence who are leading advisors in their industry by creating lasting value for their clients. Due to growth following a recent promotion they are looking for a highly skilled Business Process Optimization Specialist to join them.

As a Business Process Optimization Specialist you will work closely with clients to analyze their current business processes, workflows and procedures using techniques like workshops, surveys and stakeholder interviews. Once information has been gathered you will analyze the data to review the issues, understand how this is impacting the business make recommendations that will improve processes.

This is an exciting role where you will get the chance to lead client relationships, support the BPO Manager in executing process improvement initiatives before monitoring their progress from the metrics put in place and make a real impact in creating change for clients.




You‚Ä¶

In order to be a successful Business Process Optimization Specialist you will have‚Ä¶

Previous experience in a similar role involving data analytics and the ability to use data to create solutions that improve processes and resolve problems
The ability to walk client through the process map step by step from analysis and issues through to solutions and results
Experience working in a consultancy environment and managing relationships with a range of different stakeholders
Experience in process improvement projects would be highly advantageous
Experience in data visualization using tools such as Tableau and Power BI




If you are interested to find out more please apply for the role with an up to date copy of your CV. If you have any questions that you would like to discuss first, please call Adam on 07425 559 243.
