Title: Lead, Data and Analytics
Description:
Ascend Fundraising Solutions partners with nonprofits and foundations, supporting their fundraising efforts through innovative lottery programming. We help organizations maximize revenue, enabling them to fulfill their critical missions. To date, Ascend has helped raise over $1.4B for charities, and we‚Äôre seeking a driven individual to help us further our impact.




We're seeking a Lead, Data & Analytics to establish and drive our Marketing data strategy from the ground up. As our first data hire in Marketing, you'll have the unique opportunity to shape our data infrastructure, analytics capabilities, and decision-making processes across the organization.




Core Responsibilities

Design and implement a comprehensive data and analytics strategy aligned with business objectives
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines, working closely with engineering teams
Lead the implementation and management of our marketing analytics stack, including GTM and GA4
Drive data democratization initiatives through self-service analytics platforms
Establish data governance frameworks and ensure compliance with privacy regulations
Conduct advanced analytics to uncover growth opportunities and market segments
Build and automate reporting systems for marketing and program performance
Partner with stakeholders across the organization to drive data-informed decision making




Required Qualifications

5+ years of experience in data analytics, with a proven track record of driving impact
Expert in SQL and proficient in at least one programming language
Strong foundation in data engineering, business intelligence, and data governance
Deep understanding of marketing analytics platforms (GTM, GA4) and implementation
Experience building and maintaining data pipelines and ETL processes
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, or related field
Demonstrated ability to translate complex analyses into actionable business recommendations




Preferred Qualifications

Master's degree or MBA
Experience working in high-growth technology companies
Knowledge of modern data stack technologies
Background in marketing analytics and attribution modeling




What Makes You Stand Out

Strategic mindset combined with strong tactical execution abilities
Entrepreneurial drive and proven ability to work autonomously
Excellence in stakeholder communication and presentation skills
Track record of identifying and capitalizing on data-driven growth opportunities
Strong business acumen and ability to connect analytics to business outcomes
Meticulous attention to detail and commitment to data quality
Experience in building self-service analytics capabilities




Technical Skills

Advanced SQL and data manipulation
Data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Metabase, Mode)
Marketing analytics platforms (GTM, GA4)
ETL/ELT processes and data pipeline development
Data governance and security best practices
Statistical analysis and modeling
Business intelligence tools




What we offer

Hybrid work environment (Toronto-based - 3 days in-office / 2 days remote)
Competitive compensation
RRSP matching
Comprehensive health benefits
Education / continuous learning budget
Mission-driven work
Growth-minded culture







AscendFS is committed to building and preserving an open, inclusive, and healthy work environment. We welcome all applicants to apply to join our team. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank you for your interest in working at AscendFS and we will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

Title: Senior Associate, Analytics
Description:
GALE is a Business Agency that brings its insights to brand storytelling and activates it across every channel. With expertise in business strategy, media, CRM, brand communications, performance marketing and technology, GALE creates integrated marketing systems and communications that grow businesses. Founded in 2014, the agency has since been named Ad Age Data and Analytics Agency of the Year and Adweek‚Äôs Breakthrough Media Agency of the Year.

We work with Hard Rock, MilkPEP, H&R Block, Dropbox, and more. If you‚Äôre driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a commitment to achieve excellence in your craft, GALE is a great place for you!

GALE has nine offices around the world, including New York, Toronto, Los Angeles, Austin, Denver, Kansas City, London, Bengaluru and Singapore. GALE embraces a hybrid, flexible workplace with employees asked to attend the office three days per week.

As a global agency, we are currently hiring across multiple locations within North America, please apply today to learn more. You can check our office locations here .

Your Impact

We are currently seeking a Senior Associate, Analytics to join our rapidly growing Analytics team - people who have a passion for working with digital data and other key data sources to derive actionable insights and strategize and support the creation of performance-driven measurement plans. Successful candidates will work with clients and internal business and technical stakeholders to support measurement strategies. Attention to detail and a desire to dig deep into the data for insights are necessary. You will have the opportunity to work with various clients across different sectors. If you have most of the required skills but not all of them, you are still encouraged to apply.

What You'll Do


Present insights and recommendations to business stakeholders, both internal and external
Work with manager and internal stakeholders to build performance-driven measurement plans
Communicate data requirements for reporting and analysis to analytics engineering and ad tech
Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members
Analyze media performance data and derive business insights using Excel, Python or other analysis tools
Support Manager on strategic and technical process improvements and innovation roadmap
Run machine learning models and implement data-driven solutions to drive growth and decision-making for our clients


Who you are


3+ years of experience in delivering insights and analysis to cross-functional teams and executives using various data sources
Comfortable with presenting analysis and solution recommendations to clients and internal stakeholders
Experience translating business objectives of clients into measurement plans
Fluent in SQL, Python, and Excel
Experience with Google Cloud Platform tools like Google Big Query
Experience with one or more of the following databases: PostgreSQL, AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, Snowflake, SQL Server, and MySQL
Good understanding of A|B Testing, Experience and Campaign Optimization
Knowledge of media platforms like Campaign Manager 360 and associated measurement tracking
Knowledge of at least one leading Web Analytics platform, preferably Adobe Analytics.
Knowledge of Brand and Conversion Lift Studies


Nice to Have


Additional expertise in Google Analytics and other leading tools is preferred
Experience in the consulting and advertising industry is preferred
Experience with Data Visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker for reporting and analysis


Note: Hybrid work in office is an essential function of the job.

Our Commitment to Inclusion

We believe in inclusivity and do our best work when people with diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and skills are brought together. Our Core Values are at the root of GALE‚Äôs collaborative environment and help to foster a strong community. Our Code of Conduct, Human Resources policies, and executive investment in inclusion further support and protect GALE‚Äôs inclusive workplace. GALE is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Our Hiring Process

We want you to be just as discerning in making your next career move as we are finding great talent to join our team. Our interview process will allow you to meet a range of people from various disciplines and domains both virtually and in person. Please discuss with our recruiters if you require any accommodations throughout the process to help enable a smooth interview.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Creates and implements an integrated roadmap for all aspects of data governance. Develops, maintains and monitors data governance policies and procedures. Deploys SQL and Python code, ensures compliance with standards, and provides updates on policy changes. Ensures that data is secure, private, accurate, available and usable. Provides interpretation of enterprise data governance guidelines. Ensures data strategy and management practices are aligned in support of business objectives. Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset, adheres to the regulations around data compliance, and reduces overall risk.


Drives data governance by actively promoting improved data governance practices, enforcing policy, and following data governance best practices.
Harmonizes data in the systems through a collaborative process with members from various business units.
Develops SQL and Python code to generate reports, identify data quality issues and remediations.
Establishes, maintains, periodically reviews and recommends changes to data governance policies, standards, guidelines, and procedures.
Conducts audits to ensure that policies, procedures and metrics are in place for maintaining/improving the program.
Aligns the Data Governance policy with the overall goals of the business strategy.
Drives change in the organization to maximize the value of its data and plans for how the company will make those changes.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.


Qualifications:


Foundational level of proficiency:


Information and data strategy.
Managing change.
Privacy governance technology enablement.
Data privacy.
Enterprise data management.
Ontology design.
Master data management.



Intermediate level of proficiency:


Data governance methodologies
SQL, Dashboarding, Python, Excel Macros
IT standards and governance.
Data integrity.
Data quality.
Metadata management.
Verbal & written communication skills.
Collaboration & team skills.
Analytical and problem solving skills.
Influence skills.
Data driven decision making.
Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.



Salary:

$60,000.00 - $111,700.00

Pay Type:

Salaried

The above represents BMO Financial Group‚Äôs pay range and type.

Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group‚Äôs expected target for the first year in this position.

BMO Financial Group‚Äôs total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. To view more details of our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.bmo.com/global/en/Total-Rewards

About Us

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one ‚Äì for yourself and our customers. We‚Äôll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we‚Äôll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other‚Äôs differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Analyst, Human Intelligence
Description:
Edelman Data & Intelligence (DXI) is currently seeking an Analyst to join our Data and Intelligence team. Reporting to the Insights Manager, the role will focus on providing insights and consultative support to our account teams to help drive business results for our clients. The successful candidate will be a research professional who will utilize their experience working with data,largely secondaryin nature (e.g., social listening, media monitoring, syndicated data sets) to contribute to the growth of our Data and Intelligence business.

You will have a solid background in research methods and strong skills across the entire project lifecycle, from research design, project execution, data analysis, and reporting. You will leverage your experience, curiosity, and collaboration to support the development of innovative and creative research methods, and to uncover insights that will provide clear direction in terms of communications planning and marketing program related decision-making for our clients.

This position requires experience with various statistical methods that are necessary for interpreting data sets, as well as a passion for understanding their impact on human behaviour and the big picture. You also have excellent organizational skills, unwavering attention to detail, strong design abilities in PowerPoint or developing dashboards, and the ability to adapt to and effectively manage new conditions, assignments, and deadlines.

Beyond this, you are a clear communicator, an effective storyteller, and an adaptable collaborator who partners with internal and external stakeholders as well as your team members. You bring a positive attitude to the workplace, and you are eager to learn new things. People love working with you!

Responsibilities:‚ÄØ


Provide day-to-day research support that will assist clients in meeting their research objectiveslargely through media monitoring and analysis
Responsible for day-to-day administration of research initiatives, including implementation and oversight of studies, and responding to ad-hoc research requests
Effectively distill data into coherent analysis, insights and ultimately actionable recommendations in straight forward and simple language and communicate research findings in visually engaging PowerPoint presentations or Dashboards
Support on the development of quantitative & qualitative analyses which leads to strategic insights and ultimately recommendations against a client's marketing and communications efforts and business objectives
Effectively collaborate with external research vendors throughout the research process: data collection, data processing, and results reporting
Support Senior Staff on effectively distilling data into coherent analysis, insights, and actionable recommendations in straight forward and simple language and communicate research findings in visually engaging PowerPoint presentations
Act as a lead on Q&A of outgoing reports to ensure deliverables meet standards
Participate in client presentations and support new business pitches specific to custom primary research, measurement strategy, campaign analysis, landscape analyses, content optimization, etc.
Stay informed about client industries including their technologies, products, target markets and competitors
Maintain strong internal/external relationships; support fellow team members and an inclusive team environment



Qualifications:


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience
Must have 1-3 years of relevant experience in data, analytics, or research with potential areas including consulting, advertising, media or publishing, ideally from a communications agency or research house
Experience with the development of research and measurement frameworks based on clearly defined objectives
A demonstrated ability to think critically, solve problems, and develop a narrative based on data driven insights
Strong project management skills, including timeline development and project scoping
Advanced skills in Excel, and the ability to understand and maintain data integrity
Strong understanding of structuring and executing research, such as audience segmentation and key driver analysis
Proven ability to analyze, organize, and translate substantial amounts of data and information into clear and concise, story-telling focused presentations and plans
Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills, including strong skills in document and presentation development.
Ability to collaborate, develop, and implement measurement strategies
Strategic yet creative thinker and self-starter, who is able to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience with platforms and syndicated data sets like Brandwatch, Talkwater , Meltwater, comScore, SimilarWeb, Global Web Index, Mintel, Statista, IBIS World, etc.
Strong PowerPoint design skills and abilities, including the ability to communicate quantitative data into a visually engaging story and organize/ integrate large amounts of information into concise presentation
An understanding of data visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau is a bonus
Chinese language skills and understanding of the Chinese media landscape are a bonus
Show more
HTML:
Edelman Data & Intelligence (DXI) is currently seeking an Analyst to join our Data and Intelligence team. Reporting to the Insights Manager, the role will focus on providing insights and consultative support to our account teams to help drive business results for our clients. The successful candidate will be a research professional who will utilize their experience working with data,largely secondaryin nature (e.g., social listening, media monitoring, syndicated data sets) to contribute to the growth of our Data and Intelligence business.

You will have a solid background in research methods and strong skills across the entire project lifecycle, from research design, project execution, data analysis, and reporting. You will leverage your experience, curiosity, and collaboration to support the development of innovative and creative research methods, and to uncover insights that will provide clear direction in terms of communications planning and marketing program related decision-making for our clients.

This position requires experience with various statistical methods that are necessary for interpreting data sets, as well as a passion for understanding their impact on human behaviour and the big picture. You also have excellent organizational skills, unwavering attention to detail, strong design abilities in PowerPoint or developing dashboards, and the ability to adapt to and effectively manage new conditions, assignments, and deadlines.

Beyond this, you are a clear communicator, an effective storyteller, and an adaptable collaborator who partners with internal and external stakeholders as well as your team members. You bring a positive attitude to the workplace, and you are eager to learn new things. People love working with you!

Responsibilities:‚ÄØ

  • Provide day-to-day research support that will assist clients in meeting their research objectiveslargely through media monitoring and analysis
  • Responsible for day-to-day administration of research initiatives, including implementation and oversight of studies, and responding to ad-hoc research requests
  • Effectively distill data into coherent analysis, insights and ultimately actionable recommendations in straight forward and simple language and communicate research findings in visually engaging PowerPoint presentations or Dashboards
  • Support on the development of quantitative & qualitative analyses which leads to strategic insights and ultimately recommendations against a client's marketing and communications efforts and business objectives
  • Effectively collaborate with external research vendors throughout the research process: data collection, data processing, and results reporting
  • Support Senior Staff on effectively distilling data into coherent analysis, insights, and actionable recommendations in straight forward and simple language and communicate research findings in visually engaging PowerPoint presentations
  • Act as a lead on Q&A of outgoing reports to ensure deliverables meet standards
  • Participate in client presentations and support new business pitches specific to custom primary research, measurement strategy, campaign analysis, landscape analyses, content optimization, etc.
  • Stay informed about client industries including their technologies, products, target markets and competitors
  • Maintain strong internal/external relationships; support fellow team members and an inclusive team environment


Qualifications:

  • A Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience
  • Must have 1-3 years of relevant experience in data, analytics, or research with potential areas including consulting, advertising, media or publishing, ideally from a communications agency or research house
  • Experience with the development of research and measurement frameworks based on clearly defined objectives
  • A demonstrated ability to think critically, solve problems, and develop a narrative based on data driven insights
  • Strong project management skills, including timeline development and project scoping
  • Advanced skills in Excel, and the ability to understand and maintain data integrity
  • Strong understanding of structuring and executing research, such as audience segmentation and key driver analysis
  • Proven ability to analyze, organize, and translate substantial amounts of data and information into clear and concise, story-telling focused presentations and plans
  • Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills, including strong skills in document and presentation development.
  • Ability to collaborate, develop, and implement measurement strategies
  • Strategic yet creative thinker and self-starter, who is able to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Experience with platforms and syndicated data sets like Brandwatch, Talkwater , Meltwater, comScore, SimilarWeb, Global Web Index, Mintel, Statista, IBIS World, etc.
  • Strong PowerPoint design skills and abilities, including the ability to communicate quantitative data into a visually engaging story and organize/ integrate large amounts of information into concise presentation
  • An understanding of data visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau is a bonus
  • Chinese language skills and understanding of the Chinese media landscape are a bonus

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Join our dynamic and innovative gaming company, passionate about creating immersive and cutting-edge gaming experiences. We pride ourselves on a culture of creativity, collaboration, and a commitment to pushing the boundaries of gaming. If you're a highly motivated and skilled specialist passionate about the gaming industry, we want you to join our team. This is a full-time IN OFFICE position in Vaughan.

Position Overview:

The Data Analyst will work with large volumes of gaming data to manage and optimize the business economy. They will analyze user needs, build projections and simulations, and leverage machine learning techniques to drive effective decision-making. This role requires a strong ability to resolve complex issues and provide data-driven insights that enhance user experience and support strategic business objectives.

Main Responsibilities:


Data Analysis - Analyze large datasets to understand gaming operations, player behaviour, and revenue streams and inform strategic and operational decisions.
Product Development Support - Provide recommendations based on the game data to enhance product features, economies, and future developments.
Monetization support - Work across teams to apply insights for improving game monetization and player engagement tactics.
Performance Monitoring - Design and create automated dashboards and reports for key business metrics and insights to assess the effectiveness of gaming products/features/events, marketing campaigns, and revenue-generating initiatives.
Financial Analysis - Evaluating financial performance, forecasting revenue projections, and identifying areas for cost optimization or revenue growth
Continuous Improvement - Staying updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in gaming analytics and business intelligence. Proactively identifying opportunities for process improvement and optimization within the analytics function.
Manage multiple analytics projects in a fast-paced environment.
Provide technical and architectural guidelines for the optimal data structuring within the organization.


Requirements


5+ years in similar analytical roles in the social casino/iGaming industry.
Proficient in SQL and experience with complex data queries.
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex data into actionable insights.
Passion for the social gaming industry and an adaptable attitude.
Personal values - Proactiveness, assertiveness, goals and not tasks driven self -management
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Economics, or another quantitative field.


Nice to haves:


Experience with PowerBI
Familiarity with statistical tools and models (R, SAS)
Previous supervisory/managerial experience


Benefits


Exciting projects using cutting-edge technologies
Collaborative and supportive work environment
Competitive salary and bonuses
Opportunities for career development, growth and advancement
Fantastic company events
Benefits including extended healthcare, dental care, vision care, and disability insurance
On-site leisure facilities
On-site parking
Show more

Title: Staff Data Analyst, Core Experience
Description:
TextNow is looking for an experienced Staff Data Analyst to fuel the next stage of our growth. This person will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver analytics & insights that helpbuild and deliver an awesome, high quality and intuitive consumer app and communications platform that enables and excites our customers to connect with anyone, without the barriers of cost or complexity.

What You‚Äôll Do


Be a strong partner to cross-functional teams in understanding the extent and severity our users‚Äô pain points, especially through quantitative methods & approaches.
Provide cross-functional teams visibility into key business KPIs and metrics by developing and presenting reports and dashboards.
Independently conduct analyses using rigorous analytic methods and build recommendations that drive decision making and business prioritization
Execute upon experimentation roadmaps by implementing experiments and tests, monitoring results and presenting recommendations
Generate and share actionable insights with Director+ level leadership via written artifacts such as decks and memos, and verbally in forums such as weekly standup meetings.


Who You Are


BA/BS in a quantitative discipline like Math, Computer Science, Economics or Analytics required. MS in Business Analytics highly preferred.
8+ years of hands-on experience in business and/or product analytics, working with large, multi-dimensional datasets, preferably at fast-growing tech companies.
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written.
Skilled in extracting and transforming data from Snowflake warehouse using SQL
Hands-on experience in designing, building, operating, and maintaining Tableau dashboards
Knowledge of consumer app businesses and familiarity with concepts such as NPS is preferred.
Experience in experimentation (A/B tests, geo tests etc.) and basic statistics (e.g hypothesis testing) required.
Knowledge of commonly used analytic methods such as regression, decision trees and forecasting is highly preferred.
Experience in and ability to play ‚Äútrusted advisor‚Äù to senior and executive leadership and help make change happen.
Fast learner.
Being a fast learner also means the ability to admit defeat, ask for help and iterate quickly so you can learn from your mistakes and move ahead.
Respectfully candid with the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders as well as peers on the data team
Resourceful and scrappy with the ability to deliver insights to the right teams in a timely manner.


More about TextNow...

Our Values


Customer Obsessed (We strive to have a deep understanding of our customers)
Do Right By Our People (We treat each other with fairness, respect, and integrity)
Accept the Challenge (We adopt a "Yes, We Can" mindset to achieve ambitious goals)
Act Like an Owner (We treat this company like it's our own... because it is!)
Give a Damn! (We are deeply committed and passionate about our work and achieving results)


Benefits, Culture, & More


Strong work life blend
Flexible work arrangements (wfh, remote, or access to one of our office spaces)
Employee Stock Options
Unlimited vacation
Competitive pay and benefits
Parental leave
Benefits for both physical and mental well being (wellness credit and L&D credit)
We travel a few times a year for various team events, company wide off-sites, and more


Diversity And Inclusion

At TextNow, our mission is built around inclusion and offering a service for EVERYONE, in an industry that traditionally only caters to the few who have the means to afford it. We believe that diversity of thought and inclusion of others promotes a greater feeling of belonging and higher levels of engagement. We know that if we work together, we can do amazing things, and that our differences are what make our product and company great.

TextNow Candidate Policy

By submitting an application to TextNow, you agree to the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information in accordance with the TextNow Candidate Policy

Title: Analyst, Client & Business Intelligence
Description:
Ranked a Best Employer in Canada for 23 years, Bennett Jones is one of Canada‚Äôs premier business law firms and home to 500 lawyers and business advisors. With deep experience in complex transactions and litigation matters, and offices in Calgary, Edmonton, Montr√©al, Ottawa, Toronto, Vancouver and New York, the firm is well equipped to advise businesses and investors with Canadian ventures and connect Canadian businesses and investors with opportunities around the world. Serving clients since 1922, we are proud to be the firm that businesses trust with their most complex legal matters.

We are currently recruiting for the following role in our Toronto office:

Analyst, Client & Business Intelligence The Role

The Analyst, Client & Business Intelligence is a member of the firm‚Äôs Client & Business Development Department. Primary responsibilities will include the gathering of company, market and competitive intelligence, advising firm lawyers and management related to firm strategy, industry trends, data analysis and management.

Essential Functions

Competitive Intelligence


Provide reports for client development pursuits, including sourcing of research materials, coordinating relationship intelligence (CRM & billing), summarizing findings and presenting materials to stakeholders, including lawyers and colleagues
Assist the CBD team with target/prospect identification based on specific criteria including, but not limited to: public filings, geographic and industry segmentation, industry and market trends/activity, previous and current counsel (inside/out), and Bennett Jones‚Äô connections
Support of national Business Development initiatives, including research/analysis in support of Industry Group business plans, Bennett Jones‚Äô Key Client Program (KCP), individual lawyer‚Äôs business plans, as well as pursuits (Win Strategies) and responses to RFPs and other projects
Provide proactive insights and circulations of developments in the various industry sectors
Maintain a high level of curiosity and knowledge expansion by combing newsfeeds, participating in industry and client-related meetings, and connecting with colleagues
Assist the BD team with competitive market scans, which entails looking at competitor practice areas and/or competitors‚Äô composition, marketing and activity within a specific practice area or jurisdiction. You will look at:
Key industry markets ‚Äì verticals and geographically;
Market-sizing;
Practice names & descriptions;
# of lawyers per practice and leverage for competitor firms;
Recent deals/clients/cases;
Resources available to clients (update, issue specific brochures, etc.);
Law firm rankings; and
Associations and rankings
Highlight any trends or potential conflicts in conjunction with your research
Assist with data analysis relating to our social media publications
Assist with ad hoc reports (for example reports by Industry, region or office location).

Experience and Client Data Management


Assist with maintaining knowledge management resources
Help support client data quality by working with the CRM team to update existing contacts
Updating new contacts: ensuring companies and individuals are properly identified into various segments (c-suite, corporate counsel, etc.) and research additional information such as industry codes and LinkedIn profiles.


Continuous Improvement Implementation


Identify opportunities for improvement and develop plans for implementation, monitoring and tracking of new processes to ensure success
Creative outlook that actively seeks to expand access to the department's resources and intelligence.


Qualifications

Other Responsibilities as required


3+ years‚Äô experience in a research environment. Post-secondary degree in a relevant field of study
Familiarity with common business and corporate transactional research tools is an asset, including products like Bloomberg, CapitalIQ, Mergermarket, Pitchbook and others
Intermediate or advanced skill using AI tools for research and summary development, including ChatGPT, Tableau and Co-Pilot, and technical aptitude to learn and utilize other relevant tools
Intermediate or advanced skills with Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), and experience with visualization tools like PowerBI an asset
Curiosity with a persistent drive to expand knowledge and to provide clear insights
An ability and willingness to work with stakeholders to scope and refine desired outcomes and outputs, to shape and make efficient research processes and outputs
Able to prioritize work ‚Äì involving connecting with various participants, managing conflicting priorities, and establishing feasible timelines for projects
Analytical, creative and critical thinking ‚Äì connect dots between projects and themes, identify opportunities for involvement of additional stakeholders
A strong team player; demonstrates a positive work ethic. Strong interpersonal skills to develop cross-functional relationships within the department and throughout the firm
Highly organized with excellent attention to detail
Self-motivated and manages everyday tasks with little supervision
Maintains professionalism, confidentiality and discretion
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


Apply To:

Human Resources

Bennett Jones Services Limited Partnership

3400 One First Canadian Place

P.O. Box 130

Toronto, ON M5X 1A4

E-mail: hrdepttor@bennettjones.com



All offers of employment are conditional upon the satisfactory verification of a Canadian criminal record check. Determination of the factors that constitute satisfactory verification is within the sole discretion of Bennett Jones.


This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found.


Bennett Jones welcomes applications from all applicants, including applicants who may requires a specific accommodation because of a disability or another protected ground. Any applicant requiring accommodation during the application process should contact email noted above.

Title: Senior Analyst, Advanced Analytics
Description:
Come make your difference in communities across Canada, where authenticity, trust and making connections is valued ‚Äì as we shape the future of Canadian retail, together. Our unique position as one of the country's largest employers, coupled with our commitment to positively impact the lives of all Canadians, provides our colleagues a range of opportunities and experiences to help Canadians Live Life Well¬Æ.

At Loblaw Companies Limited, we succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong.

Does working with some of Canada‚Äôs most talented minds in innovation supporting retail, digital consumer solutions and analytical platforms excite you? Loblaw Technology powers some of Canada‚Äôs most game-changing retail solutions, giving our customers the ability to live their lives well.

Come work with a team that values diverse ideas, fosters a culture of inclusion and develops our talent from within. Loblaw Technology gives you the chance to excel, and helps you to strive for success in a big way. Keep reading to learn more!

Senior Analyst, Advanced Analytics, Brampton, ON

As the Senior Analyst in the Advanced Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to provide analysis and recommendations related to high profile loyalty initiatives; as well, the Senior Analyst will build products to automate data-informed decision making of the business for the future of loyalty. The Analyst will work with various business partners in the Enterprise on analytics, insights, product, reporting, and measurement to help with these initiatives.

What You‚Äôll Do:


Leverage your analytical skills to develop, refine, and innovate loyalty data products that are not only relevant today but are also designed with a future-forward lens.
Enhance the organization‚Äôs understanding of our customers and develop or improve customer targeting mechanisms through segmentations, algorithms, and ML models
Work with business stakeholders across the Enterprise on translating requests into analytical problems. Requests can be strategic or tactical, ad-hoc or long-term in nature
Extract and synthesize large amounts of data from multiple sources, including customer transaction data, consumer & syndicated research to provide insights that will inform and guide the strategic evolution of our loyalty program.
Apply statistical techniques to measure campaign performances, and lead A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the efficacy of different strategies
Support the weekly execution tasks related to the loyalty program to guarantee its smooth and effective operation, ranging from list generation to performance measurement


What you Bring:


Strong understanding of business operations and the ability to convert analytical insights into viable business strategies
Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders and capable of managing a piece of work independently
Fundamental knowledge in statistics and basic mathematical modeling capabilities, with ability to conceptualize real-world situations using simple mathematical models
Advanced skills in SQL, including data manipulation and understanding of SQL procedures/functions. Basic to working proficiency in Python, especially in context to data analysis tasks, is an asset
Intermediate understanding of ML algorithms, with a willingness to explore and apply ML techniques in analytical contexts
Genuine passion for analytics and a continuous learning mindset


What Loblaw Offers You

We offer flexibility and balance, and an environment that sets you up for success no matter where your workspace is located.

Here, you will find a great team to help you achieve your goals as you help us achieve ours! Work in our fast-paced, exciting Technology environment, helping our stores, colleagues and customers every day.

Loblaw colleagues also enjoy:


Work Perks Program
On-site GoodLife Fitness, Basketball & Volleyball courts, Ice Rink, Dry Cleaning services (1PCC Office)
Tuition Reimbursement & Online Learning
Pension & Benefits
Paid Vacation


If you‚Äôre up to the challenge, then we would love to hear from you. Apply today, and get the process started.

Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation‚Äôs evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. At Loblaw, we celebrate diversity and strive to build a culture of inclusion where differences are embraced, valued and supported. We are committed to being an equal opportunity employer and encourage people from all backgrounds and identities to apply to our jobs. Accommodation in the recruitment, assessment, and hiring process is available upon request for applicants with disabilities.

We thank all candidates for their interest but please note, those candidates who meet the minimum requirements for the position will be contacted.

www.Loblaw.ca/careers

Our commitment to Sustainability and Social Impact is an essential part of the way we do business, and we focus our attention on areas where we can have the greatest impact. Our approach to sustainability and social impact is based on three pillars ‚Äì Environment, Sourcing and Community ‚Äì and we are constantly looking for ways to demonstrate leadership in these important areas. Our CORE Values ‚Äì Care, Ownership, Respect and Excellence ‚Äì guide all our decision-making and come to life through our Blue Culture. We offer our colleagues progressive careers, comprehensive training, flexibility, and other competitive benefits ‚Äì these are some of the many reasons why we are one of Canada‚Äôs Top Employers, Canada‚Äôs Best Diversity Employers, Canada‚Äôs Greenest Employers & Canada‚Äôs Top Employers for Young People.

If you are unsure whether your experience matches every requirement above, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are looking for varied perspectives which include diverse experiences that we can add to our team.

We have a long-standing focus on diversity, equity and inclusion because we know it will make our company a better place to work and shop. We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. We encourage candidates to make their accommodation needs known so that we can provide equitable opportunities.

Please Note:

Candidates who are 18 years or older are required to complete a criminal background check. Details will be provided through the application process.

At Loblaw Companies Limited, we succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong.

Does working with some of Canada‚Äôs most talented minds in innovation supporting retail, digital consumer solutions and analytical platforms excite you? Loblaw Technology powers some of Canada‚Äôs most game-changing retail solutions, giving our customers the ability to live their lives well.

Come work with a team that values diverse ideas, fosters a culture of inclusion and develops our talent from within. Loblaw Technology gives you the chance to excel, and helps you to strive for success in a big way. Keep reading to learn more!

Senior Analyst, Advanced Analytics, Brampton, ON

As the Senior Analyst in the Advanced Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to provide analysis and recommendations related to high profile loyalty initiatives; as well, the Senior Analyst will build products to automate data-informed decision making of the business for the future of loyalty. The Analyst will work with various business partners in the Enterprise on analytics, insights, product, reporting, and measurement to help with these initiatives.

What You‚Äôll Do:

  • Leverage your analytical skills to develop, refine, and innovate loyalty data products that are not only relevant today but are also designed with a future-forward lens.
  • Enhance the organization‚Äôs understanding of our customers and develop or improve customer targeting mechanisms through segmentations, algorithms, and ML models
  • Work with business stakeholders across the Enterprise on translating requests into analytical problems. Requests can be strategic or tactical, ad-hoc or long-term in nature
  • Extract and synthesize large amounts of data from multiple sources, including customer transaction data, consumer & syndicated research to provide insights that will inform and guide the strategic evolution of our loyalty program.
  • Apply statistical techniques to measure campaign performances, and lead A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the efficacy of different strategies
  • Support the weekly execution tasks related to the loyalty program to guarantee its smooth and effective operation, ranging from list generation to performance measurement

What you Bring:

  • Strong understanding of business operations and the ability to convert analytical insights into viable business strategies
  • Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders and capable of managing a piece of work independently
  • Fundamental knowledge in statistics and basic mathematical modeling capabilities, with ability to conceptualize real-world situations using simple mathematical models
  • Advanced skills in SQL, including data manipulation and understanding of SQL procedures/functions. Basic to working proficiency in Python, especially in context to data analysis tasks, is an asset
  • Intermediate understanding of ML algorithms, with a willingness to explore and apply ML techniques in analytical contexts
  • Genuine passion for analytics and a continuous learning mindset

What Loblaw Offers You

We offer flexibility and balance, and an environment that sets you up for success no matter where your workspace is located.

Here, you will find a great team to help you achieve your goals as you help us achieve ours! Work in our fast-paced, exciting Technology environment, helping our stores, colleagues and customers every day.

Loblaw colleagues also enjoy:

  • Work Perks Program
  • On-site GoodLife Fitness, Basketball & Volleyball courts, Ice Rink, Dry Cleaning services (1PCC Office)
  • Tuition Reimbursement & Online Learning
  • Pension & Benefits
  • Paid Vacation

If you‚Äôre up to the challenge, then we would love to hear from you. Apply today, and get the process started.

Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation‚Äôs evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. At Loblaw, we celebrate diversity and strive to build a culture of inclusion where differences are embraced, valued and supported. We are committed to being an equal opportunity employer and encourage people from all backgrounds and identities to apply to our jobs. Accommodation in the recruitment, assessment, and hiring process is available upon request for applicants with disabilities.

We thank all candidates for their interest but please note, those candidates who meet the minimum requirements for the position will be contacted.

www.Loblaw.ca/careers

Our commitment to Sustainability and Social Impact is an essential part of the way we do business, and we focus our attention on areas where we can have the greatest impact. Our approach to sustainability and social impact is based on three pillars ‚Äì Environment, Sourcing and Community ‚Äì and we are constantly looking for ways to demonstrate leadership in these important areas. Our CORE Values ‚Äì Care, Ownership, Respect and Excellence ‚Äì guide all our decision-making and come to life through our Blue Culture. We offer our colleagues progressive careers, comprehensive training, flexibility, and other competitive benefits ‚Äì these are some of the many reasons why we are one of Canada‚Äôs Top Employers, Canada‚Äôs Best Diversity Employers, Canada‚Äôs Greenest Employers & Canada‚Äôs Top Employers for Young People.

If you are unsure whether your experience matches every requirement above, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are looking for varied perspectives which include diverse experiences that we can add to our team.

We have a long-standing focus on diversity, equity and inclusion because we know it will make our company a better place to work and shop. We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. We encourage candidates to make their accommodation needs known so that we can provide equitable opportunities.

Please Note:

Candidates who are 18 years or older are required to complete a criminal background check. Details will be provided through the application process.

Title: Analytics Lead
Description:
Insight Global is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Analytics Lead to join our client's rapidly expanding team in the medical gas supply industry. This role requires a dedicated professional who will be on-site in North York, ON, five days a week, adhering to standard Monday to Friday working hours.




Key Responsibilities:

Utilize data analytics to forecast growth and examine all aspects of the business, identifying areas for improvement and increased efficiency.
Summarize and communicate analytical findings to C-level stakeholders, providing actionable insights and recommendations.
Collaborate with various departments to gather and analyze data, ensuring comprehensive business analysis.
Develop and maintain advanced Excel models, including macros and pivot tables, to support data analysis and reporting.
Manage and optimize the use of Salesforce CRM and QuickBooks for data management and financial analysis.
Leverage Google Suite tools to enhance data analysis and reporting processes.
Work independently to accomplish tasks in a timely manner, ensuring high-quality deliverables.




Required Qualifications:

3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Financial Analyst.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced features such as macros and pivot tables.
Experience with Salesforce CRM and QuickBooks.
Familiarity with Google Suite tools.
Strong ability to work independently and manage time effectively.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to summarize findings and present them to C-level stakeholders.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience within the healthcare industry.
Proficiency in Power BI and SQL queries.




Salary range starting at $55k/year depending on relevant skills and experience.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

Are you a talented, creative, and results-driven professional who thrives on delivering high-performing applications? Come join us!

Global Functions Technology (GFT) is part of RBC‚Äôs Technology and Operations division. GFT‚Äôs impact is far-reaching as we collaborate with partners from across the company to deliver innovative and transformative IT solutions. Our clients represent Risk, Finance, HR, CAO, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Financial Crime, Capital Markets, Personal and Commercial Banking and Wealth Management. We also lead the development of digital tools and platforms to enhance collaboration.

We believe that innovation should drive all that we do, in challenging assumptions and being big and bold with our ideas. We support our people in developing the technical, business and professional skills needed to be successful. You will work with partners from across the company, participate in networking events, and have access to a wide variety of supports including mentorship. You will work directly with leaders who believe in celebrating successes and sharing learnings with other teams to promote progress.

The HR Technology team is responsible for optimizing and modernizing the systems and tools that support HR functions. These functions include recruitment, learning, performance, operations and talent data management. In HR Tech, we aim to improve the overall employee experience, enhancing efficiency and effectiveness, using modern and emerging technologies.

Job Description

As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for business analysis activities on medium to large sized projects in a technical environment. Candidates must demonstrate knowledge and ability and can apply the competency in new or complex situations. You will be responsible for execution of all aspects of requirements delivery - planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation, management, and support.

What will you do ?


Elicit and analyze Business requirements and create documentation such as current and future state business process, user stories, data catalogues, business rules, use cases and user interface design.
Contribute to requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out priorities and meet quarterly and annual business objectives. Work collaboratively with our business partners and stakeholders from multiple IT teams.
Analyze and review different options for data integration and provide recommendations on the solution.
Incorporate enterprise standard requirements methodology in requirements planning, analysis and documentation.
Work with project managers, developers, quality engineers and other business analysts, to ensure that projects are delivered on time and within budget.
Support User Acceptance Testing by supporting planning, development of test cases and execution of tests. Communicate effectively, written and verbal, to various audiences (technical and non-technical).


Must Have:


Minimum of 2 years of working experience as a Technical BA or BSA.
Experience working with Waterfall, Agile and Hybrid Methodologies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, inquisitive nature, and comfortable challenging status quo.
Experience working with multiple stakeholders in various roles, identification of scope, enforcement of change management processes while maintaining strong relationships.
Experience analyzing data using SQL, and or other tools .
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.


Nice to Have:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, or related (technical) degree/diploma
Strong knowledge of fundamental data concepts (for example, but not limited to groups, hierarchies, data structures).
Experience working with ML or AI tools
Experience working with tools like Jira & Confluence.


What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work


Job Skills

Agile Methodology, Business Data Analysis, Business Process Modeling, Commercial Acumen, Communication, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Group Problem Solving, Interpersonal Relationship Management, Requirements Analysis

Additional Job Details

Address:

20 KING ST W:TORONTO

City:

TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

TECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONS

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2025-02-10

Application Deadline:

2025-02-28

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com</a/span>

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the world‚Äôs leading financial groups. Across the globe, we‚Äôre 120,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.

With a vision to be the world‚Äôs most trusted financial group, it‚Äôs part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.

Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.

Responsibilities:

Statistical Modeling - responsibilities include:


Developing and maintaining credit risk Scorecard models, including but not limited to Probability of Default and Loss Given Default Models
Playing a key role in advancing the Machine Learning initiatives including data collection and preparation, feature engineering, parameter tuning, and exploring academia for new approaches.
Working with model validation and governance teams to develop methods and metrics for relevant model validation.
Creating reports and presentations for the Group Manager and Senior Management.


Technical skills:


Strong programming skills in at least one of Python, SAS or R
Strong skills in statistical modeling and machine learning methods, including Regression (Linear/Logistic etc.), Decision Tree models such as Gradient Boosting Machines, and Neural Networks.
Proficient in data querying languages: SAS/SQL
Proficient in Microsoft Office Programs: Word, Power Point, and Excel


Qualification:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative or computer programing field such as Quantitative Finance, Economics, Statistics, or Computer Science.

Relevant experience in financial/economic modeling and/or Scorecard modeling preferred through prior internship, undergraduate/graduate level research, or work position.

The job description and related application pertains to an opportunity with either MUFG Bank, Ltd., Canada Branch (‚ÄúMUFG Bank Canada‚Äù) or MUFG Securities (Canada), Ltd. (‚ÄúMUFG Securities Canada‚Äù). The job description relates to the general nature, scope, quantity and quality of work contemplated for the position. Other duties and responsibilities not specifically described may be assigned from time to time, consistent with knowledge, skills and abilities of the incumbent. The receipt of an application by either MUFG Bank Canada or MUFG Securities Canada, as applicable, does not imply or guarantee employment.

Each of MUFG Bank Canada and MUFG Securities Canada is an equal opportunity employer.


As a federally regulated entity, MUFG Bank Canada is required to comply with applicable laws which prohibit discrimination based on protected grounds and which require accommodation to individuals in accordance with the requirements outlined in the Canadian Human Rights Act and the Canada Labour Code. Where MUFG Bank Canada obtains information relating to protected grounds under the Canadian Human Rights Act as part of the application process, it does so to monitor and otherwise evaluate its own compliance with such legislation and associated regulatory requirements; MUFG Bank Canada does not use such information for decision making purposes relating to the position contemplated in this application.
As a provincially regulated entity, MUFG Securities Canada is required to comply with applicable laws which prohibit discrimination based on protected grounds and which require accommodation to individuals in accordance with the requirements outlined in the Human Rights Code (Ontario) and the Employment Standards Act (Ontario). Where MUFG Securities Canada obtains information relating to protected grounds under the Human Rights Code (Ontario) as part of the application process, it does so to monitor and otherwise evaluate its own compliance with such legislation and associated regulatory requirements; MUFG Securities Canada does not use such information for decision making purposes relating to the position contemplated in this application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Quality and Food Safety function digital transformation program
Description:
Job title: Senior Data Analyst - Quality and Food Safety function digital transformation program

Location: Greater Toronto Area




About Us:




Welcome to Lactalis Canada ‚Äì where we take pride in being recognized as one of Forbes' 2022 top employers! Our journey revolves around enhancing the lives of Canadians through a rich variety of dairy delights, including some of Canadian‚Äôs favourite dairy brands such as like Black Diamond Cheese, Lactantia Milk, Astro Yogurt, Balderson Cheese, and Cheestrings. In fact, we‚Äôre proud to say our products grace the shelves of an incredible 94% of Canadian households!




With a 140-year legacy driven by innovation and unwavering quality, we‚Äôre seeking like-minded individuals to join us in shaping our next chapter. Our flexible hybrid work model accommodates 40% remote work, adapting to the evolving needs of our workforce. Step into a collaborative hub with our revamped office, and enjoy free parking, endless coffee, delicious Lactalis snacks, an on-site gym, and more!




About the opportunity:




The Quality and Food Safety Data Manager (Senior Data Analyst) leads the Quality and Food Safety function digital transformation program, starting with the development and implementation of a new data collection and reporting framework for Quality and Food Safety at Corporate and plant levels, analyzing and interpreting complex data related to quality and food safety metrics, identifying trends, and providing actionable insights to enhance processes and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations. This role plays a crucial part in driving continuous improvement in quality, food safety, and operational efficiency (process streamlining, productivity) across the organization by leveraging data-driven approaches.




The attributes we are looking for:




Implement new digital tools or upgrade existing data management systems to improve data volume, accuracy, accessibility, and analysis efficiency.
Lead the Quality and Food Safety (QFS) digital transformation program as a priority pillar of the function long-term plan (LTP).
Implement and manage the Datahex App, Suite (Paperless, Supplyline, MyHaccpPlan) and etc. at the plants.
Work closely with IT team, the plants and DQG function at the Lactalis Headquarter in Laval to implement in Canada the Quality and Food Safety IT solutions requested by Lactalis Headquarter (Zendesk, Labvantage LIMS‚Ä¶)




Project Management:




Lead Quality and Food Safety digital transformation projects.
Participate in quality improvement and food safety projects, ensuring milestones and objectives are met.
Collaborate with project teams to ensure that data-related aspects are incorporated effectively and provide insights to enhance decision-making processes.




Data Analysis & Reporting:




Collect, clean, process and analyze quality and food safety data from various internal and external sources (e.g., labs, production lines, supply chain, audits, complaints, etc).
Generate reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to communicate findings, key performance indicators (KPIs), and trends to stakeholders.
Support the development of predictive models to anticipate potential risks related to food safety and quality issues.
Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze data and predict trends.




Process Improvement:




Identify patterns and trends in food safety and quality data that indicate opportunities for process improvement.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Production, Supply Chain, R&D, and Regulatory Affairs) to implement corrective actions and improve operational performance.
Monitor through KPIs the effectiveness of quality and food safety initiatives and continuously provide feedback to optimize processes.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and IT tools related to Quality 4.0.




Stakeholder Collaboration:




Serve as a key liaison between the Quality & Food Safety team and other departments, including corporate teams as well as plants, to share insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Collaborate with external partners, suppliers, and regulatory agencies to ensure data accuracy and to support quality and food safety initiatives.
Provide technical support and training to staff and plants on using data systems and reporting tools, focusing on the Datahex App, Suite, and etc.







What you will bring:




Master‚Äôs degree in data science, Statistics, Manufacturing performance, or a related field. Bachelor‚Äôs degree associated with significant professional experience will also be considered.
3-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a manufacturing and quality & food safety environment.
Proven track record of using data analytics to drive quality and food safety process improvement.
Knowledge of Change management and Lean Manufacturing tools and methods
Strong Project management skills
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and statistical software (e.g., Minitab).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
Ability to analyze large data sets and provide meaningful insights to improve processes.
Ensuring accuracy in data collection, reporting, and analysis
Effectively communicate complex data and findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Work effectively across teams to implement quality and safety improvements.
Ability to work independently with multiple stakeholders on multiple projects simultaneously.




What Lactalis will offer:




Lactalis Canada believes in rewarding its people with the following comprehensive benefits package and perks:




A Competitive Base Salary
A Performance-Based Bonus System
4 Weeks of Vacation
Benefits starting day 1
A Pension Program with an Employer Match at 100% of up to 6%
Tuition reimbursement plan of up to $3,000/year
A Volunteer Day to give back to your community
Learning and Development opportunities
A commitment to internal career advancement with potential for international mobility







Our ESG commitment:




Our ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) roadmap drives our sustainability mission. We aim to positively impact communities and the planet by enabling stakeholders including our people, consumers, customers, suppliers, dairy farmers, government, and industry partners to have a positive impact on the wellbeing of our communities and the planet through all that we do.




At Lactalis Canada, we value our employees as catalysts for positive change. Together, we will create a sustainable future, promote belonging, and make a lasting impact on the world.




Our commitment to DEI:




Fuel Our Culture with Your Uniqueness! Lactalis thrives on the value each person brings. We're dedicated to amplifying diverse voices, inviting personal and professional growth, and embracing everyone's true selves. We're committed to crafting an environment that genuinely welcomes all, reflecting the richness of our people and communities.
